Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

results.description:
Cabin fever got ya down? Work it out at the Dance Walk! Bring your own ipod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is "dance walking"? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. For inspiration, check out:

www.24hoursofhappy.com

results.description:
Okay fellow togs,

It's getting cold out.  It's that time of year again. Let's do some photography inside.  Inside the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

I'll start with a 30 minute photo class covering low light photography and photography in museums.  No tripods or flash photography on this one.  But we can capture wonderful pictures regardless.

From Ancient Egypt to Medieval Europe to Africa, Oceania and then on to the classical world of the Ancient Greeks and Romans, we will encounter works that reflect humankind's highest achievements.

We can make it a photographic highlights tour which includes the Arms and Armor Gallery, the Temple of Dendur, the Asmat Canoe and of course Van Gogh.

Let's see who can tell this story in the most powerful way.  Check out images from last year under "past meetups" to see what you can capture.

The fee includes the class, admission to the museum and my photographic support at the museum until 2:00pm.  You are free to stay until closing if you like.

There is limited participation so RSVP early.

Meanwhile, just keep clicking',

Michael

As part of our ongoing group within a group - our Book Club meetup for January is scheduled for: Saturday, January 30th

The book of the month is: Big Little Lies by Liane Moriarty Amazon Book Overview/Summary:

The new novel from the author of The Husband’s Secret
A #1 New York Times Bestseller Sometimes it’s the little lies that turn out to be the most lethal. A murder…A tragic accident…Or just parents behaving badly? What’s indisputable is that someone is dead. Madeline is a force to be reckoned with. She’s funny, biting, and passionate; she remembers everything and forgives no one. Celeste is the kind of beautiful woman who makes the world stop and stare but she is paying a price for the illusion of perfection. New to town, single mom Jane is so young that another mother mistakes her for a nanny. She comes with a mysterious past and a sadness beyond her years. These three women are at different crossroads, but they will all wind up in the same shocking place. Big Little Lies is a brilliant take on ex-husbands and second wives, mothers and daughters, schoolyard scandal, and the dangerous little lies we tell ourselves just to survive.


I look forward to seeing you all for some coffee and fun book discussion! :)
results.name: January Book Club & Coffee

results.description:
Please read through ALLLL the details before asking questions!! Lets spend the day at MOMA. A link for purchase of a timed viewing ticket for the special exhibit of Picasso Sculpture is listed below (everyone purchases their own ticket), the ticket for $25.00, includes a general admission entry to the rest of the museum, meeting time is at 10:30am in the lobby. The timed Picasso exhibit ticket  I purchased is for a 2:00 viewing time slot, join me at that time, if you wish, (I suggest purchasing early so we can all view the exhibit as a group). I have posted details for the day with the understanding that things happen, we may get separated and the details give us a chance to regroup if you wish to, I also do not want to spend the day on my cell phone trying to hunt people down if I can help it, we want to relax and enjoy this experience, and please do feel free to go off on your own if you prefer. Dinner at Barilla Restaurant 1290 Avenue of the Americas at Radio City for those interested before returning home. I will try to hold to times posted, but please understand moving around with a large group of people can be difficult keeping everyone together.

Picasso Sculpture

Picasso Sculpture is a sweeping survey of Pablo Picasso’s innovative and influential work in three dimensions. This will be the first such museum exhibition in the United States in nearly half a century.

Over the course of his long career, Picasso devoted himself to sculpture wholeheartedly, if episodically, using both traditional and unconventional materials and techniques. Unlike painting, in which he was formally trained and through which he made his living, sculpture occupied a uniquely personal and experimental status for Picasso. He approached the medium with the freedom of a self-taught artist, ready to break all the rules. This attitude led him to develop a deep fondness for his sculptures, to which the many photographs of his studios and homes bear witness. Treating them almost as members of his household, he cherished the sculptures' company and enjoyed re-creating them in a variety of materials and situations. Picasso kept the majority in his private possession during his lifetime. It was only in 1966, through the large Paris retrospective Hommage à Picasso, that the public became fully aware of this side of his work. Following that exhibition, in 1967 The Museum of Modern Art organized The Sculpture of Picasso, which until now was the first and only exhibition on this continent to display a large number of the artist’s sculptures.

Picasso Sculpture focuses on the artist’s lifelong work with sculpture, with a particular focus on his use of materials and processes. The exhibition, which features more than 100 sculptures, complemented by selected works on paper and photographs, aims to advance the understanding of what sculpture was for Picasso, and of how he revolutionized its history through a lifelong commitment to constant reinvention. The exhibition is organized in chapters corresponding to the distinct periods during which Picasso devoted himself to sculpture, each time exploring with fresh intensity the modern possibilities of this ancient art form.

Click here to purchase: Timed tickets are required for entry to Picasso Sculpture.

Picasso Sculpture timed tickets include general admission to the Museum.

Visitors are strongly encouraged to present their ticket on their mobile device or print their online tickets at home for expedited entry.

Please feel free to arrive anytime during the half hour after your selected time (for example, if your ticket is for 11:00 a.m., plan to arrive anytime between 11:00 and 11:30 a.m.)

Please note that there is a $1.50 per ticket ShowClix service charge for reserving timed tickets in advance.

A limited number of general admission timed tickets will be available for same-day sales depending on capacity on a given day. 

Getting there:

If you wish to join me for the travel: I will be heading down for this event on the train. I am planning to take a Metro North Train from Milford train station at 7:58 and arriving at Grand Central Station at 9:50. Ticket round trip is $28.02. After you purchase your ticket meet me on the train platform for departure time.

I am planning to walk to MOMA, only a 13 minute walk.

If you would rather take the subway - The subway will get you near the museum in 11 minutes. Take a 3 minute walk to Madison/East 42 Street and take M3 to  - Madison/West 52-53, then a 4 minute walk to 11 West 53 street. Double check Subway details.

We can grab lunch at Café 2 in the museum around 12:30-12:45  or so before the timed viewing, if you wish.

Dinner at Barilla before heading home if you wish (1290 Ave of Americas Radio City, entrance on south side of 52nd st).

Please do check the details and comments frequently for updates on details.

results.description:
Our third Monozukuri Saturday meetup in 2016 features Jonathan Sparks, an artist & maker living in Brooklyn, NY. 


https://vimeo.com/98813434

Jonathan's work lives at the intersection of sound, fabrication, design and technology. By combining computer programing, fabrication, electronics, and multimedia, he has created an eclectic body of work spilling over across medium and genre. His works have included original musical instruments, projection mapped installations, mobile applications, and what could loosely be categorized as weird physical objects which may or may not move or make noise. 

Please visit his profile page to know more of his work.

We plan to have a Max/MSP workshop after the meetup. RSVP.

Max/MSP interface

Agenda (10.30am - 11.30am):

Review Projects

-Show/briefly discuss my work

- Nomis,Phone Vocoder, Helix

- others

- NIME, Georgia Tech, Bricolo


Different technical approaches

-Analog circuits

- basic square wave generation - 555 timer

- Atari punk synth

- oscillator ICs

- can get fairly complicated quickly

- analog filters

- diy / “stomp box” communitie

- Using Arduinos

- basic square wave (similar to 555) with tone()

- sensors - buttons/simple switches, potentiometers, piezos

- wave shield - can play mp3 files, opens up possibilities, samplers

- teensy + audio adapter

- teensy has an arm chip (similar to Android based phones) so way more powerful

- paired with adapter you can do actual synthesis

- talk about different types of synthesis?

- Raspberry Pi

- Can use PureData (PD)

- better for output/synthesis rather than signal processing, audio in is not trivial

- though I have heard people have made stop boxes out of it

- Computer assisted

- Serial communication and/or MIDI

- Max MSP / Pure Data

- Map midi using GarageBand, Ableton, probably lots of others


General Design/ Interface considerations

- interface

- gesture

- control, functionality


Further exploration:

NIME.org

Handmade Electronic Music - Nicolas Collins

------------------------------------------------------

After that (11.30am - 2.30pm) , we are going to have Max MSP workshop! Please download the software from here (both Mac and Win).

Looking forward to seeing you guys tomorrow!

results.description:
I have been reading Oracle and Tarot cards for over 15 years now and still have an ongoing romance with them. I love giving readings with them and teaching others to do the same. I do not however believe that the process should be long and overbearing. Many classes offered today either lack the depth of knowledge needed to read and leave you to do all the work on your own or are many days long with little knowledge gained except for memorization. You should not ever have to memorize, in fact that can inhibit the reading process all together.  I take all of the nonsense out and give you what you need from purchasing, cleansing, reading, and caring for your cards in just the three hours. We will go over the basic spreads and finish with creating your own! We will end with reading each other!

I have added an extra hour to this class to allow for more hands on/ practical application time. I have had both children and adults with more than 20 years experience take this class and all had amazing results. You are welcome to bring a deck or borrow one of mine, it does not matter.

Testimonials:

Seriously...I ADORED the workshop and learned so much and am so excited and motivated to delve deeper...all because I had such a great teacher! If I can return the favor by inviting you to a future class...please lmk! I'd love to introduce you to belly dance!"

"I attending the Tarot Card workshop with JD and it was phenomenal! By far exceeded my expectations. The class went above and beyond Tarot cards and I met a new group of wonderful people with similar interests. It truly felt like we had been friends for years as we each encouraged each other to try different techniques and trust in ourselves. I was surprised at how much helpful information I walked away with. We started with a meditation that opened us to receive divine messages of inspiration. We ended with more possibilities than we imagined. Opens a whole new world. Truly fascinating...

JD-thanks so much and I look forward to the next one:)~Gia al Quamar

Cheers to Living In The LightLove,~Talia M."

results.description:
SPECIAL! SIGN UP FOR BOTH DAYS AND RECEIVE A FREE 1-HOUR PRIVATE INSTRUCTION SESSION ON LIGHTROOM IN FEBRUARY 2016!

Adobe’s Lightroom is hands down the most important and widely used software available for photographers. From beginners to seasoned pros, it is the foundation of a digital photographer's workflow, the place to both start and finish all of your photographs. This is a full day, hands-on workshop on everything you need to know to to get you up and running with Adobe Lightroom. This class is designed to completely demystify the interface and it’s capabilities, shedding light on all of the tools and power Lightroom affords.  


https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/yJnu2hoF9ajx9kOfILbmtRjTBeT4LM-lmEQ2pShihT8glwiSoXHamwpLhXC4fLYWewpzVqy9g5K_8LD86k2mqPO2qSWc6OBA91smErZFeK21ZqpVP1yw--dAzggFdwBhXhkQj6tG


Lightroom, from its inception, was designed to be used in a very specific way. Any workflow, from beginner to professional, has three components, Input, throughput and output. Lightroom was custom designed to provide for all three of these essential parts of workflow, Input (ingesting new images and organizing them (Digital Asset Management), throughput (processing/developing the files) and output (sharing by social media, personal website or email and printing). In this 6-hour workshop, Cliff will provide an overview of all of these features, briefly demonstrating how they were designed to be used. By the end of this class, when you open up Lightroom, it will makes sense, you will know where to start and feel comfortable diving in .  

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/cKW7CFSMseY1XDLqopPMO9zhw1nu3_cj6dwiOTpp42VNuIRfPK-fVt9KZFOnBIiKkauNce9vWv3xCPcePkKM3lVY5yw7WOh8vdmNyrfl3Tlffb66M7WMyFr5rKHfuOsZ1d9VHkWT


Click here for a gallery of some of Cliff’s recent work, showcasing what is possible using Lightroom to it’s full potential.  


This class is the first class in a two-part series. By covering all of the essentials, it provides a solid foundation from which to learn more advanced editing and workflow techniques covered in the second day of this workshop.  


https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/6VbaRF9WU9SnfB5hbIzRdCgTE5dOWGBCDXk8YWmOy1FjvGVzIVY2xmt4gOcW9N8CCtgm0c-BgHgEoC8j1ufihKxWFbYhfQBYBwVpP-e-lgBsTBL0-iUHrhmWV4LCCKuQ2-DrZCqy


For the first class, laptops are suggested but not required as while this is a hands on, fully interactive class, students can follow along every step of the way and take notes as Cliff walks you through the entire latest LR interface.  


If you are serious about learning Lightroom, a first-time user or an experienced veteran looking to harness the power of the latest version of Lightroom, this is the workshop for you. It is important to know that those you not using the latest version of Lightroom CC can follow right along as the design and layout has changed very little. The latest version of LR, however, is available as a free trial for 30 days or may be purchased through the Adobe website along with Adobe Creative Cloud Photoshop for $9.99/month. Click here for a link to download the free trial.  


https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/uTLA71IJ3L_bxreN3QdWIzLb_ddKyYrlTebSmnFmd9CWnifakmX8FXQ3QvIH7L755k7-ozv6guMyeHKgPbYoTbzSvdl08j2q2xHX1DKkTl6tJD1b7GDgn1_TmBEvj6clXk0LlpCd


Topics to be covered in this 6-hour PRELIMINARY OVERVIEW workshop:

LIGHTROOM FOUNDATION:

• LR catalog explanation and system setup

• Overview of preferences and recommendations to achieve best performance

• Overview of software layout from modules to tabs to overlays to menu structure

• Customization settings to improve ease of use, removal distractions and maximize performance

• Overview of workflow and backup solutions


INPUT:  Digital Asset Management (DAM):

• Overview of the library module and organization strategies

• Overview of the lightroom catalog system and use of image previews

• Overview and recommendation of best techniques for organizing and finding your images


THROUGHPUT:  Post-processing - development module:

• Brief overview of the development modules and All of the tools available;

• Explanation of best practices in image development in a non-linear workflow

• Demonstration of development tools - best approach - what to do and what not to do


OUTPUT - Sharing your images with the world:

• Overview of the Print module

• Overview of Book module

• Overview of Slideshow module

• Overview of Web module

Optional: A laptop with Version 4, 5, 6 or CC of Lightroom on it or even better - download the latest trial version - this is strongly recommended. You may download a trial version of Adobe Lightroom from the Adobe website here:


https://www.adobe.com/cfusion/tdrc/index.cfm?product=photoshop_lightroom


Please also bring the POWER CORD to your laptop as this is an ALL DAY Workshop – you will need to plug in.

About the Instructor:

Clifford Pickett is a professional travel photographer, commercial photographer & videographer, event photographer and educator. He is based in NYC but his work takes him around the globe. He first picked up a camera while spending a year traveling through Europe after having earned his MBA early. Like many travelers, that passion for seeing and experiencing the world is precisely what ignited the spark for photography. Clifford has since spent all of his time learning how to see and capture the world with what he refers to as "a new mind". He hasn't been shooting for 40 years, he hasn't been alive for 40 years. He hasn't been classically trained in the fine arts either. He is entirely self-taught, which has formed within him his greatest asset: the ability to relate to the amateur photographer. Leveraging both the business and photography skills he has developed and maintained for over a decade, he is the owner of several successful photographic enterprises and a corporate commercial video production company working with clients such as Google, Apple, Adidas, Estée Lauder, Sephora and Clinique. His work has been featured in National Geographic, the smithsonian, and many other publications.  To see some of Cliff’s work, you may visit his website at: www.cliffordpickett.com.

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/1Ua36IqnvahUOi-rf6etYJ6vi_jEqLSXpxqaArx5cc4ddkFOM0ZumqMQx-4g85NnvxFUGeGM_Q2ZIJF_1Cjv8Tz7l-NuTeneGePx2CGjJ0_AmI6OjEg84_RWNSuikaiBbkOEnoo

results.description:
The theories of all the known 4 physical forces - electromagnetic, weak, strong and gravitational - are all gauge theories. The principle of gauge invariance puts strong constraints on the set of allowable interactions in physics. Miraculously, by enforcing  these local internal symmetries, we recover precisely those physical properties which Nature manifests.

In this first part of what I hope will be several discussions, we will introduce Classical Field theories and the principle of least action in a field theory context.

Siddhartha will "turn on h-bar", indicating why we need a quantum theory of fields in the first place. As a warm-up for later discussions, he will introduce the Dirac and Klein-Gordon equations. Hopefully, if time allows, he can also discuss the canonical quantization prescription

Where are we going with all of this? Ultimately to a deep appreciation of the power of the gauge principle in particle physics.  Later presentations will focus on quantizing the photon and electron fields and show that the gauge principle governs allowed interactions between these fields. We hope to understand non-Abelian gauge symmetries by studying Yang-Mills theories as well.

A knowlege of basic quantum mechanics will be required.

Please join us for this interesting discussion.

Some material to digest....

The first two QFT lectures by David Tong....

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=8yplCob7_Ck


https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=LsmF5-k7Yso


Sometimes these lectures are somewhat challenging to see, so here are the printed lecture notes to follow along....

http://www.damtp.cam.ac.uk/user/tong/qft/qft.pdf


This set of lectures is a bit condensed, but covers many of the relevant topics...

http://www.hep.phy.cam.ac.uk/~gripaios/gft_lecture_notes.pdf


Or read any number of on-line papers or the first couple of chapters of your favorite QFT texts.
results.name: Gauge Theories and the Standard Model of Particle Physics Part I

results.description:
The holidays are over.  We're now two weeks into 2016.  Have you declared any goals for this year?  If you have, have you yet taken any committed action toward having them happen? 

Or is it the case that you started to, but then quickly lost steam?  Is it the case that, now that you've fallen back into your regular routine, all those dreams and goals have fallen by the wayside -- like they always do. 

You'll start writing that screenplay next week, when you've got more time.  You'll pick up that guitar next weekend, when you feel a little more energized.  You'll start hitting the gym in a couple months, when it gets a little warmer. 

Next week turns into next month turns into next year turns into never.  Over time, you start convincing yourself that your goal that you at one point wanted so badly, that you felt so inspired and enlivened by, "was never really that important anyway." 

The truth is, many of us have had the same "New Years' Resolutions" for years.  Get fit.  Get engaged.  Save money.  Travel abroad.  Visit family. 

This will be the year, we tell ourselves.  But then, the year goes by, like all the others.

Want this year to truly be different?

Join us Saturday, January 30th, 11am to 2pm (at our apartment in Astoria, Queens) for our first meet-up of 2016.  We'll have open discussion on this topic and do some awesome exercises that will support you in having the 11 remaining months of 2016 be full of accomplishing all those long overdue goals.

You may think you know what's been stopping you from achieving your heart's desire -- but, if you truly knew, wouldn't you have achieved it by now?  Wouldn't you have achieved it years ago, when you first declared that's what you wanted? 

Here's a hint:  the reason you haven't achieved your heart's desire yet is NOT because:

-you don't have enough time
-you don't have enough money
-you're not talented enough
-you're too old
-you're too tired
-you don't have enough support
-you've got too many other things going on
-you're too busy
-you're not ready
-you're not motivated enough

So, if it's not one of those things, then, what is it? 

Come join us Saturday and find out.  We don't claim to know what the exact answer is for you, but, you do (you're just not conscious to it yet) -- and we (and Mr. Grant in particular) DO know how to support you in having it be revealed.

As always, the charge for this meet-up is $10, to be paid at the door upon entering.

THIS can be THE year -- it starts with the simple act of coming to this meet-up (January 30)!


Whether you're a returning member or a new face, we are looking forward to seeing (and supporting) you!


In Service,
Jim & Kyla Grant
results.name: You Survived the Holidays - Now What?

Fraunces Tavern is the oldest building in the city and served as George Washington's headquarters. It now contains both the original restaurant as well as a Revolutionary War museum upstairs. 

It's a small museum, so you'll have free reign to draw whatever you like. Or step outside and sketch the building as well, which is beautiful. 

We'll meet upstairs at the entrance and each buy our own tickets. Tickets are only $7.


Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!


---------------------------------------------------------------

What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Please bring your own supplies - anything you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave any dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.

results.description:
Hope you weathered Storm Jonas well. 


This is a rescheduled gathering following last weekend's cancellation. I feel it is important to complete our look at the Ten Perfections and discuss Equanimity. That means that the start of our next series - the Foundations of Mindfulness will begin the following Saturday, February 6th.

This week we wrap up our conversations on The Ten Perfections and take a look at Equanimity. 

Many of us eventually realize during our search for peace and happiness that it doesn’t matter if we attach ourselves to things we believe will bring us happiness or strongly avoid things we believe will deny us happiness.  Neither of those strategies lead to lasting satisfaction and we can be easily tossed around between the two. 

With skillful attention, patience, wisdom and clear vision of these sometime dueling mind states, we can come to understand that their interplay is always changing. This becomes our portal into the reality of impermanence. From that insight we can start seeing the opportunities we have to settle in the middle; being more even tempered, centered or balanced in our responses because we come from a place of knowing or wisdom. Equanimity is the manifestation of that wisdom.

There is one “near enemy” of equanimity that can be tricky - indifference. It masquerades as equanimity, so we must use our skillful, vigilant attention and courage to be the peaceful balance of equanimity itself. The traditional phrase of the equanimity meditation offered by Joseph Goldstein reminds us of the way:  “I am the heir of my own actions, my happiness and unhappiness depends on my actions, not upon on my wishes.”

The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.

The Ten Perfections are important mind/body qualities or strengths that we can cultivate in any life situation and on the cushion.  When we make these Perfections our priority in life, they support us on our journey toward awake awareness.      

The Ten Perfections or qualities of mind are:

Generosity (Giving) 
Virtue (Morality/Ethics) 
Renunciation (Letting go of obstacles to awakening) 
Wisdom (Discernment) 
Energy (Effort) 
Patience (Endurance) 
Truthfulness 
Determination/Resolution 
Loving Kindness/Goodwill 
Equanimity (Impartiality and balance)
results.name: The Ten Perfections - Equanimity (this is rescheduled from 1/23/16)

results.description:
Bonjour...Et bonne annee a tous !

Even here in New York City we are able to glimpse some animals in their natural habitat (not rats in the subway... lol). It is way more exciting to see animals in the wild than it is to see them at the zoo. 

And you won't have to leave the city for our first winter 'Aventure' – Take the 6 train to Pelham Bay Park in The Bronx for a “seal shore safari” – the perfect place to see a little bit of wild life in our own urban jungle.

I can't guarantee 100% that they will be here, but as the temperatures drop, seals migrate south through open water and often call the Bronx home for the winter. Then, every fall, hundreds of harbor seals start their annual journey from Maine for a warmer climate, traveling south until they reach the temperate waters surrounding Long Island.

Up to 17 have been seen at once (from the NE coast of Twin Islands)

Our walk will start by looking for a group of seals sunning themselves off the coast of Pelham Bay Park in The Bronx, and walking from Pelham Bay Park to City Island, a quaint fishing village in the Bronx. A bridge away from the American mainland of the Bronx, City Island has retained a unique small-town, atmosphere frequently compared to that of a New England fishing village.

Then we can have Lunch on City Island at an outdoor waterfront cafeteria, or bring your own lunch. 

Le tout bien entendu, en francais !

NOTICE THAT :

-Dress appropriately for the weather, it's often colder and windier along New York City's beaches. 

-Bring binoculars if you have some.

-The meeting time is (before lunch) at 11:00 AM : Pelham Bay Park (#6)

-If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Merci !

In case my phone number is 347 <a>[masked]/[masked]</a>

A bientôt !Alex

DESCRIPTION:
Korean Brunch? While I quietly mourned the passing of Ktown's Arirang and its delicious handmade noodles. Fortunately, Dadam's simple menu of Korean broths and soupy noodle dishes has arrived to help fill that hole in my culinary life. I ordered the seafood soup noodle dish and was soon slurping down the thin, chewy noodles colorfully tinged with different colors. The broth was very light but still flavorful. I was also given the opportunity to sample the pumpkin soup, which proved itself a wonderfully hearty, warming dish. It is especially satisfying with winter weather arrives in force. If you find yourself in Ktown, make your way to Food Gallery 32 and head up to the second floor to try it for yourself.

• HTML & CSS (Thimble) 

• Circuits (littleBits)


Orientation starts at 11:30am sharp!

This is an orientation in the morning to volunteer for a workshop for kids in the afternoon. This is not for parents & youth.

No previous experience necessary, laptops not required.

Schedule 

11:30am Orientation
01:00pm Workshop Begins
2:30pm Presentations Begin
3:30pm Clean-up

results.description:
Our new Book Club Selection! 

Read the book, come to the discussion! 

Essentialism- The Disciplined Pursuit of Less

INSTANT NEW YORK TIMES AND WALL STREET JOURNAL BESTSELLER 

Have you ever found yourself stretched too thin?
  Do you simultaneously feel overworked and underutilized?
  Are you often busy but not productive?
  Do you feel like your time is constantly being hijacked by other people’s agendas?
  If you answered yes to any of these, the way out is the Way of the Essentialist.
  The Way of the Essentialist isn’t about getting more done in less time. It’s about gettingonly the right things done.  It is not a time management strategy, or a productivity technique. It is a systematic discipline for discerning what is absolutely essential, then eliminating everything that is not, so we can make the highest possible contribution towards the things that really matter. 

By forcing us to apply a more selective criteria for what is Essential, the disciplined pursuit of less empowers us to reclaim control of our own choices about where to spend our precious time and energy – instead of giving others the implicit permission to choose for us.

Essentialism is not one more thing – it’s a whole new way of doing everything. A must-read for any leader, manager, or individual who wants to learn who to do less, but better, in every area of their lives, Essentialism  is a movement whose time has come.


This is a FREE meetup event.
results.name: Book Club-EssentialismThe Disciplined Pursuit of Less

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson as he runs the first D&D 5E Module over two parts!

The Sword Coast is siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

This campaign follows the module of the same name, and will be broken into two parts with six sessions each.
results.name: D&D 5E: Hoard of the Dragon Queen, Part 1

results.description:
Join the amazingly talented Conde Nast graphic designer/illustrator, Leonard Cadiente for a four hour drawing intensive!

Leonard will teach the technique he uses to draw the amazing images below. If you have ever been to one of our drawing sessions you know Leonard's work always draws a crowd, so we decided to offer a workshop for people to learn this technique. 


Attendees should be prepared to work for the entire session with very limited breaks. There will be two models starting in leotards and adding draped clothes as we progress. At least one model will be posing continuously throughout the session.

This intensive session is for people with at least some drawing experience (email me if you have questions). It is great for people who are currently studying drawing and want an intensive workshop to push them forward. 

The amazing room we work in!

Supply requirement are a 14x17 pad that you can see through: Marker Bristol, tracing or vellum. Any drawing medium they're comfortable to draw with. 


Classical music will be played during the session.

Leonard Cadiente is a graduate of Parsons School of Design majoring in Fashion Illustration.

He has been a graphic designer at Conde Nast Publications for over 35 years and has done extensive freelance illustrations while there. 

He has illustrated for Bloomingdales and many publications and fashion houses. 

"It was in my senior year At Parsons that my talent as an illustrator blossomed. The most influential of all my instructors was Barbara "Bobbie" Perlman. Everyone of my peers who had her were very much influenced by her technique. She taught you how to really draw. My "technique" of drawing is rooted on her teachings."  - Leonard
results.name: Intensive Drawing Workshop for Figure and Fashion

results.description:
Have a script for a Horror, Action or Thriller Short film (and/or related sub-genres)? Looking to get your Idea off from paper to a visual medium? Depending on participation 3-4 scripts will be selected for production. Upcoming Meetups will be scheduled revolving the selected scripts. This is an important Meetup as it will:

• Create Upcoming Projects


• Relate to The group's future Meetup Scheduling. 

Actors, Filmmakers, artists looking to be a part of an upcoming project, feel free to RSVP for this Meetup. Positions will be filled for each selected project (depending on attendees)

Mandatory (If Presenting a Film Script): 


• Have a 10 Page (Max) 5 Page (Min) Screenplay, synopsis and character breakdown on hard copy and/or Downloadable version.  

• Pitch your screenplay
results.name: Let's Review Film Scripts for Upcoming Projects

Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer and at the same time, meet fun new people and make some new friends! 

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

Why RSVP says +40? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be about 50 members attending and this will sell out!

Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer and at the same time, meet fun new people and make some new friends! 

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit   

Tickets start at just $55.75 (limited # available, price will go up to $59.75 as event gets closer)

*MUST PREPAY HERE (TIX WON'T BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. It is also not ethnic specific. It is a multi-group event and all are welcome.  

Why RSVP says +40? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be about 50 members attending and this will sell out!

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
Happy New Year ladies.. Hope everyone is doing great... We will be having our New Year meet and Greet at Qi. This meetup is for new and old members to come together and mingling get to each other and hopefully make a friend... Qi is a A stark-white, chandelier-lit room with the backdrop for creative Thai & other Southeast Asian eats. It is a lovely chic atmosphere but very affordable..
Any entrée on the regular menu
and lunch special menu comes
with a complimentary appetizer.. Lunch starts at $8.95 also $1.50 for a small chicken Tom Yum
soup or Thai iced tea with lunch.. It is a really beautiful place that you never thought exist in the heart of NYC... I look forward in meeting you ladies...
results.how_to_find_us: Ask Host for Alana.. He/she would direct you our table
results.name: New Year's Meet & Greet [Open RSVP/NO WAITLIST]

results.description:
Here's a video from our last performance; "Santa Baby"


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Eq5zNQPuFw

This Season we are playing The Beatles!

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles is certainly due in our selection!

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Saturday 12-2pm starting January 9th til April 23rd, the day before the performance, 16 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (16 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $380  (you save $50 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

All you need is love and some Beatles!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge
results.name: Let's Play The Beatles!

results.description:
From Goodreads--

"Having survived World War I, Fidelis Waldvogel returns to his quiet German village and marries the pregnant widow of his best friend, killed in action. With a suitcase full of sausages and a master butcher's precious knife set, Fidelis sets out for America. In Argus, North Dakota, he builds a business, a home for his family—which includes Eva and four sons—and a singing club consisting of the best voices in town. When the Old World meets the New—in the person of Delphine Watzka—the great adventure of Fidelis's life begins. Delphine meets Eva and is enchanted. She meets Fidelis, and the ground trembles. These momentous encounters will determine the course of Delphine's life, and the trajectory of this brilliant novel."

The total vote from both the November Meetup and the poll was--

The Master Butchers Singing Club--15

A Pigeon and a Boy--4

The English Patient--0
results.name: January --  The Master Butchers Singing Club by Louise Erdrich

results.description:
Please note the postponement of this Meetup from January 23 to January 30 due to the predicted snowstorm.

We've been reaching out with some success for the kinds of resources that will be required to realize our vision. Volunteers, professional expertise, and funds are becoming available. Join us to hear all the encouraging details!
results.name: New year, new resources

results.description:
Bollywood Funk NYC is back and the weather gods have finally smiled upon us. So lets get ready and start our first Naach  Xpress class in Jersey City for the year 2016. New to dancing? Don't worry. Just take a chance at dance and I am sure you will have a lot of fun at this class. (Hint Hint: This is also related to the song which we plan to do this session)

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it! 


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g 

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!
results.name: Naach Xpress Class JC- Take a chance at dance

group.name: Naach Xpress- Dance and Exercise the Bollywood way!

results.description:
Hey ALL,

If you would like to play for 2 sessions then you can also sign up for back to back time slots as well.

We will be having TWO 1.5 hr sessions each Saturday.

If you'd like, you can sign up for both and play all 3 hours or you can just sign up for either one.

We will be playing FUTSAL - 8 minute round robin matches with THREE teams of 5 (4 and a sub). Music PROVIDED!

GYM FLOOR/BRING FLATS!!!!! Please make sure to show up a little early to <a>CHECK</a> IN and to get changed and warmed up so we can start ASAP. We will wait for noone!
See you out there!
results.name: Futsal Workout

venue.name: Edith G Read Natural Park and Wildlife Sanctuary *

results.description: This is going to be the snowiest walk of the season, wear boots and gloves and I'm sure there will still be frosty spots on the trail. Let's see what birds have decided to brave January in New York. As always, I will bring the chocolate!!!!
results.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing my Snowy Owl Cap. Meet at parking lot closest to entrance of sanctuary
results.name: Snowy Owl Snowy Walk!!!!

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, January 30th from 12-2pm for this 2-hour FREE MeetUp where you will connect, network and learn how to keep yourself energized, healthy & focused - NATURALLY.

Entrepreneurship can be very rewarding.However, if you are not careful, it can wreak havoc on your health & wellbeing. Do any of these sound familiar?

• Your sleep is disturbed because your mind is going a thousand miles a minute with new ideas and things to get done. 

• You over-caffeinate yourself throughout the day to help you focus on your business only to find a big crash in your energy later.

• You constantly have some sort of "cold" because your immune system is weakened by overworking & constant exposure to germs via hand shaking, group meetings.

• You feel overwhelmed & exhausted by the amount of things you have to do in a 24-hour period with little or no time left for self-care. 

• You experience body aches - back, neck & wrist pains - from being on the computer for hours on end. Not to mention, the chemical commercial cleaners in your workspace that can overtax your body. 

There are so many internal & external forces that can effect your energy levels. 

Yoga and Essential Oils are both natural & effective ways to keep your body and your mind healthy and functioning at peak levels. 

Learn how to use simple yoga techniques & essential oils in order to:

• Increase the quality of sleep you get at night 

• Boost your energy, naturally. 

• Support your immune system. 

• Improve concentration and focus. 

• Create a self-care routine that is easy & implementable. 

• Manage pain due to extended computer use. 

• Reduce chemical exposure in your home/office space.

Come prepared to network & have fun. We will discuss, experience, & learn how to apply these amazing modalities of natural health. You will leave feeling inspired & empowered to use these tools to boost your health, well-being & productivity in business.

PLUS THERE WILL BE BONUS SURPRISE GIVEAWAYS!!! 


Our featured presenter


Jason Wendroff-Rawnicki is a Wellness Advocate for DoTerra Essential Oils, an ERYT200 certified yoga teacher and co-owner of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, NJ. Through both essential oils and yoga, Jason guides his clients to keep themselves healthy and happy naturally. With all the stress and strain that entrepreneurship brings, he incorporates these two modalities to keep himself performing at optimum capacity. 

Your Host

Tracy Robin

Tracy Robin is a Certified Life Coach & Business Mentor for entrepreneurs, an ERYT500, a Certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher, the co-owner & founder of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, New Jersey and the director of Shine Yoga Center’s Yoga Teacher Certification Program. Tracy left a corporate gig in the entertainment industry after struggling with the physical, mental & emotional toll the stress level took on her life. Then she became an entrepreneur! This brought with it a whole new breed of stress. Tracy is thrilled to share user-friendly practices to help reduce stress & anxiety and guide you to a place of greater joy & self-awareness. She coaches clients globally and travels nationally & internationally leading classes, workshops & retreats. 

Who can attend?

Women Entrepreneurs and women starting or transitioning into their own biz - who are passionate about personal & professional development, and who want connect and be in community with other dynamic women in business.

What should I bring?

Business cards, a friend if you'd like, an open mind

How much does it cost?

IT's FREE. BUT PLEASE RSVP here on Meetup so we can count you in.

Want to be the first to know about our upcoming events & gatherings? Interested in doing a giveaway or sponsoring our next event? Contact Tracy for more information. 


SPACE PARTNER 

Shine Yoga Center (@shineyogacenter) is a modern yoga studio and event space in Cliffside Park, NJ, only 10 mins from NYC via the GWB. Interested in our classes or hosting your next event at Shine? Learn more at http://www.shineyogacenter.com/main

results.description:
Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer and at the same time, meet fun new people and make some new friends! 

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit   

Tickets start at just $55.75 (limited # available, price will go up to $59.75 as event gets closer)

*MUST PREPAY HERE (TIX WON'T BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. It is also not ethnic specific. It is a multi-group event and all are welcome.  

Why RSVP says +40? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be about 50 members attending and this will sell out!

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
Come and photograph the majestic Grand Central terminal -- capture all of the details in the shadows and highlights with HDR photography! We have special permission to use tripods during this five hour workshop. We have led workshops to photograph the Grand Central terminal with tripods more than a dozen times. 


We will meet at 12:30 at GCT and shoot from 1pm until 6 pm. Please note that we understand that some people do not have the stamina for a five hour shoot, there are seats in the food court downstairs and seats in the station master's office where you can rest, or you may leave early (just turn in your permit before leaving).

Meet outside of the station master's office, there is an area to the left of the SMO. The SMO is the customer waiting area with the glass doors on the upper level of the terminal, at the top and just to the right of the escalators on the west side of the building (near tracks 34/35 and the Transit Museum store.

You will be taking 3-10 exposures in order to capture all of the details in the shadows and highlights. Tom and I will be helping you with compositions, checking exposures, etc. We are very hands on, helping you with your camera settings, interpreting histograms, etc. as much as you need it. Don't be afraid to ask! After everyone is up to speed then we will be shooting too, but will aid you with compositions, answer questions, check in on your exposures, etc. Ask us anything, shoot next to us the entire day or roam around. Experienced photographers can utilize us for as little or as much assistance as desired. For many of our participants getting the inside scoop on locations and compositions and getting access and being able to use a tripod is reason enough to come with us! We will get you up to speed because we have been there with tripods so many times we know some great compositions!

As always, you must sign sign a liability waiver for this photo tour.

Please note that all of our workshops require the participants sign a liability waiver. Download it here; then print, read and sign it. Some venues may also require a location liability waiver.

See more images here:
results.how_to_find_us: Meet outside of the station master's office, to the left of the SMO. See below
results.name: HDR (High Dynamic Range) Workshop with tripods at Grand Central

results.description:
Our last Amazing Scavenger Brooklyn Museum Hunt was a big hit so we're doing it again! 

This is an INDOOR hunt and includes admission to the Brooklyn Museum. You will receive a series of clues and perform mental and physical (nothing too strenuous) challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. You can sign up as a team (2-4 members) or as an individual and we will put you with a team. Each member of the winning team receives a gift package.

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1230PM

Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect:  

• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  

*Tickets $35-$40 depending upon when you purchase - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1230PM

*We only have a limited # of tix available. Ticket price will go up as event gets closer so get yours ASAP.

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress comfortable – Most teams wear sneakers. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, a smart phone if you have (fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. You can download that before you come.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure hunt. 

What if it rains/snows? No problem, the scavenger hunt is all indoors.

How many people will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup event and we have over 20 groups co-organizing it. We expect up to 50 members to attend.

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1230PM
results.name: The Amazing Museum Scavenger Hunt (includes entry to BKLYN Museum) PREPAY ONLY

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1230PM

Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect:  

• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  

*Tickets $35-$40 depending upon when you purchase - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1230PM

*We only have a limited # of tix available. Ticket price will go up as event gets closer so get yours ASAP.

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress comfortable – Most teams wear sneakers. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, a smart phone if you have (fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. You can download that before you come.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure hunt. 

What if it rains/snows? No problem, the scavenger hunt is all indoors.

How many people will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup event and we have over 20 groups co-organizing it. We expect up to 50 members to attend.

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_1230PM

results.description:
Vilhelm Hammershoi (1864 - 1916) was a Danish painter of solitude and light.  His work will remind you of Vermeer, and even Edward Hopper.  24 of his paintings are on view at Scandinavia House.  We're timing this visit to include a 35-minute tour of the exhibit.  The tour is free, but admission is $5.

Sample painting:


Here's a link to the exhibit:   http://www.scandinaviahouse.org/app/uploads/2015/09/Painting-Tranquility-Press-Release-09.22.15.pdf

To get acquainted before the exhibit, we'll meet a few blocks up Park Avenue, at a very special coffee bar & high-end chocolate store called Two Beans.  See link to their beverage menu.  They usually have some light snacks available, such as yogurt or pastries.  You'll want to wander around and browse the chocolate shelves!


http://2beans.com/module/myblogs/pagecontent?post_id=11

After getting acquainted, we'll walk 3 blocks to Scandinavia House.

When the tour ends, you can check out the Scandinavian design shop and the Scandinavian packaged food stand in the lobby.


If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll have a red folder and Meetup sign.  Look for me either at ground level (at tables in back of store), or at a table upstairs
results.name: See Paintings by Vilhelm Hammershoi--"The Danish Vermeer"--at Scandinavia House

results.description:
Host:  Rolando.

Evidence & Existence: 
Is there compelling evidence for the existence of god? What impact does it have on the meaning of our lives? 

“A belief is not merely an idea that the mind possesses; it is an idea that possesses the mind.”

                                                        --Robert Bolton

Atheists, agnostics, and believers alike are all welcome to discuss and debate what promises to be a lively and stimulating two-part tendentious topic! 


First, we will establish what evidence is, what makes evidence compelling, and whether (or to what degree) there is/is not evidence that is compelling to persuade us that God exists. Notice that we are not arguing whether or not God exists; we will analyze and evaluate the evidence related to God’s existence. We will also consider whether there is evidence that God does not existence. We will consider the relation of these beliefs (either in the affirmation or negation) to the evidence. For example, given what we discuss regarding the evidence, are we justified in our beliefs, for or against? 

Then, we will consider the impact our beliefs have (as it relates to how they are formed based on the evidence we have considered) on the meaning and purpose of our lives. 

Is there a qualitative difference in one’s life if she believes in God, as opposed to someone who don’t? Does it have an impact at all or none whatsoever? Is there any difference in how one sees the purpose of his life if he believes in a God as opposed to someone who doesn’t? We’ll also consider some thought experiments: if someone fervently believed in God, but there were no God in reality, would that change her quality of life? If, conversely, an atheist believes that there is no God, but there is really is one, would that affect the current quality of his life in any way? Belief, evidence, and its impact—these are the major considerations for this discussion on this day.

At the end of our discussion, we may have made new friends, sworn enemies, or new-fangled frenemies.  In any case, we can, for those so inclined, take ourselves to a nearby restaurant for a late lunch and drinks.  

About the Moderator:

Rolando is an educator of educators. He works with teachers from the four major disciplines—Math, Science, English, and History—to craft, hone, and assess their pedagogical practices. He has hosted other discussion groups on Meetup on reasoning and truth, self-understanding, self-deception, and how discussions affect our lives. In his spare time, he enjoys reading, writing, and ruminating on evidence and existence and its relation to belief and impact. . .
results.how_to_find_us: Walk up to the 2nd floor.  You'll see me (Rolando) in the back.
results.name: Is There Compelling Evidence for God?  What Impact Does It Have on Our Lives?

All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!

****************************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes / molded cleats only. Wear proper Soccer attire.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, all players need to rotate in goal. Full size goals.

5) If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

See you pitch side!

Grand FC
