results.description:
Once again, it's ON! This adult event will be open and free to everyone - members and their guests - just be sure to add your 'pluses' when you RSVP so that we have an idea how many we should expect. When you arrive, please ask for Daniel, who'll introduce you to other members of the group. From there, you can order some food/drink or you can simply get started on playing your favorite board & card games.

As for the room layout, there will be a number of different "Board Game" stations which are tables with different board games already set up - all you will have to do is pick a station and wait for some more players, or simply join a game already in progress! 

Decks of cards for Spades, Tonk, etc. • Uno • Taboo • Cards Against Humanity • Dominoes • Battle of the Sexes • Chess / Checkers • Connect Four • Cranium • Guesstures • Jenga • Scrabble & more

There will also be some open tables for people who would like to bring their own games - feel free to bring your favorite.

Drink specials will include house red, white, or rose for $5. Again, this event is free and you are not required to buy food or drinks, but let's help support Manhattan Brew & Vine as they are supporting us for use of their space.


The event starts at 3pm and is officially over at 8pm, but may run a little longer, depending on energy/turnout/interest.


If you have any questions, feel free to post them below in the comments section or call/text Daniel @ 774.275.3646.

Directions to Manhattan Brew & Vine - 998 Columbus Avenue

Take the B or C subway trains to 110th Street, walk 2 avenues west to Columbus Avenue then down one block to 109th street. The venue is on the corner of 109th street & Columbus Avenue.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside venue, on the corner of 109th Street & Columbus Avenue
results.name: Games Day! Board Games / Card Games / & Trivia! - Free To Attend!

results.description:
NAVA = North Atlantic Videogame Aficionados. This is a FREE event bringing gamers together for competition, trading, and chatter.

Previously at NAVA...


- In our last episode, we celebrated both the “Re-Gifting” Season & Star Wars with our Star Wars Holiday Special.


- We had our annual “Gift Grab” and many great gifts were exchanged and NAVA regular Frank “The Tank” had a little prank pulled on him with arguably the worst gift ever which included a broken PS1, half a Game Gear, 5 copies of both Kinect Adventure and PlayStation Sports. We all had a good laugh and then gave him his real gift.


- The arcade challenge was Star Wars & Frankie won with 881,491 points, and walked away with a $20 gift certificate for hi

s prize.
- Games and systems traded hands between attendees who brought their own trade boxes.

See it all in our photo gallery section at the store's website and feel free to comment!
http://dpvideogames.com/galleries/

This Month's NAVA: we pay tribute to our Robot Overlords. As many of you remember back in 2011 the Robot Wars began and our now almighty rulers took mercy on us and allowed us to live and will continue to allow us to live so long as we pay homage every year with our Robot themed NAVA. So this NAVA we will be playing games that feature our glorious leaders such as Berzerk, Tech Romancer, and Robotron 2084.

Arcade challenge! During the Robot Wars where we foolishly fought against our most merciful leaders we played games like Robotron 2084 and Berzerk. To celebrate our illustrious rulers we will prove our inferiority by playing the sequel to Berzerk as our arcade challenge; Frenzy. Frenzy is a lot like Berzerk except with more robots, destructible walls and walls that you can bounce your lasers off of. Be the best at the game on this one day by logging the highest score on our arcade cabinet by 9pm and win a nifty $20 gift certificate and possibly get your name added to the "House Champion" tournament plaque on the Wall of Fame just above the arcade section of the store. Arcade challenge games are set to FREE PLAY all day, but please remember to let everyone get a shot. If you get the high score, move on, and no hogging the cabinet! Also if you have won last month’s NAVA arcade challenge you are no eligible to win this month’s challenge.

Tournament! To honor the might and power of our magnificent masters we will play Cyborg Justice as our NAVA tournament. Cyborg Justice is a fighting game where instead of a character selection screen you have a robot customization screen. You pick between a body, legs and arms. For example some of your choices for arms include flame throwers, bazookas, & buzz saws. Sign-ups begin at 3pm, the tournament starts around 6pm and its first-come, first-served in this FREE-to-join tournament.

Starting this NAVA we will also be instituting a new rule about trade boxes. In the past few years more and more people have been brining trade boxes and the amount of space people take up is growing as well. From now on trade boxes cannot take up more than 5 square feet. To clarify 5 square feet is an area that is 5 feet by 1 foot, or 2 and a half feet by 2 feet. From now on all trade boxes must be contained to that much space. We will make exceptions for those who bring art or homebrews. If you bring something you made yourself we will not prevent you from putting out both that and an appropriately sized trade box. We will also make exceptions if you have items that themselves are large, like boxed systems or special editions to certain games. If you brought a CIB Steel Battalion we’re not going to make you pack up half of your other items in your trade box. We will ask you to pack up some things if you bring a lot of large items. We cannot have such large trade boxes anymore because it’s a fire hazard. 

Remember to get your trade boxes in order so we can all buy, sell and trade together. Wear your NAVA or Digital Press t-shirt for the maximum discount on store purchases. Also, bring your Nintendo 3DS to share street passes... it's NAVA time!

RSVP (optional): http://www.facebook.com/digitpress?sk=events
When: Saturday, January 30th, 3pm to midnight.
Where: Digital Press Videogames: http://tinyurl.com/7nobzcr
What happens: Gaming, trading, tournaments, big prizes! Extra game stations are set up around the store. Attendance is FREE. Half price for kids!
What can I bring?: It's nice to share. Snacks, soda and beer are always appreciated. Cakes have been very popular as well.

Monthly swap meet and tournament.

This event is FREE!

results.description:
This is an online summit delivered into your inbox -- If you dream of having more freedom – to work when you want, from wherever you want, doing what you love and working with people who light you up – I know you’ll love this.


It’s a f*r*e*e online training that’s all about how to create more freedom in and through your business, and in your life – and I’m part of it!

Get more information or register here: You Freedom Business Summit


My colleague, Alison Palmer, spiritual-social freedom business coach, has identified over 9 different freedoms you’ll want to create in your business.  Here’s some of them:

. Freedom to work from wherever you want– a café on the Champs Elysées in Paris, the foothills of the Himalayas, an African village, your own home – and WHEN you want

. Freedom to be personally fulfilled in your business and Be Fully You!  Loud and Proud!

. Freedom to embrace your Spiritual Journey in your business and live your Divine Soul Purpose.

. Powerfully helping other people to achieve their freedoms – of more joyful, healthy and happier lives.

. Time Freedom so that you have lots of energy and time to be with the people you care most about.

This is one training you do not want to miss!  And there’s heaps of free goodies waiting for you when you join.  Get more information or register here:  You Freedom Business Summit

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at the set of benches in the middle on the left inside the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead when you get past coat check. At 4:15pm we will split up. Then meet up at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30.

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing from the theme of a dark haunted forest as portrayed in many Dark Fantasy and some Horror mediums. Deep in this forest can be found many cursed and wicked beings such as lost spirits, hermit witches, twisted treefolk, black unicorns, dark elves, corrupted fairies, abnormally sized arachnids, and the list goes on. Join us as we take a walk deep into the darkside of the woods with only our pencil and pad in hand to tackle drawing the sorts of woodland denizens we come across.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

Follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: The Dark Forest

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

5-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Note: this isn't a support group for those sad or depressed. Please do not attend if you feel others somehow have the responsibility of "making you happy." Keep reading!

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

<a href="http://internal.psychology.illinois.edu/%7Eediener/Documents/Kesebir-Diener_2008.pdf">In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: Exploring the Nature of Our Happiness! Citicorp at 53rd & Lex. Host: Michael Y.

results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.

results.description:
If you are a believer in the idea that"Speaking Things Into Existence" gives the green light for those things in which we desire to manifest in our lives... then this meetup is for you!

Join us as we get together to discuss our dreams and goals for 2016 and beyond. All you'll need is an open mind and the belief that you deserve all of the things that you hope for.

A vision board is any sort of board on which you display images that represent whatever you want to be, do or have in your life. That can be Love, Success, Financial Freedom, Peace, Centered Spirituality, Focus, Health and the list goes on!

I will supply the poster boards, tape, glue sticks, markers, scissors, a few magazines, and a few bottles of wine to help get our creative juices flowing! You can also bring your own poster board if you have a particular board style in mind! (Just let me know so that I don't buy more than we need!) *To also help me out make sure to only Rsvp if you're sure that will attend and if your plans change please update your Rsvp! Thank youuu! ;)

I encourage you guys to bring along any magazines, photos or print outs that represent the things that you desire in your life. I will bring about 12 Cosmopolitan magazines but feel free to add more variety and bring your own. This helps to ensure that there is something for everybody to create a complete, fulfilling vision board.

You can also bring any snacks or beverages that you like as well, although it isn't required.

I look forward to seeing you guys and I can't wait to create these vision boards and watch as all of our dreams come into fruition!

Examples of vision boards:

The Subways to take to get to the space are: A, C, E, B, D, F, M. It is located on West 3rd Ave. and Laguardia Place. If you have any questions or need help finding it feel free to reach out to me at[masked]!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the 2nd floor. The suite is straight ahead, and the space is the second door down the hall to the right. 2nd floor, Room 4.
results.name: Vision Board Party: Claiming What's Yours!!

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation

results.description:
This is a very entertaining, funny comedy that is also thoughtful and will get your attention all the way to the end.

Un Cuento Chino ("A Chinese Take-Away", Argentina, 2010) has solid reviews.  You will greatly enjoy movie, as well as our informal Spanish conversation before and after the film. 


All our movie events are with our own projector, large screen & sound system. 

EVENT GOOD FOR ALL LEVELS OF SPANISH - 

EVENT SCHEDULE - Saturday, January 30th, 2016

5:15 pm: Door opens. Meet others and practice your Spanish!
5:45 pm: A brief intro to the movie - Movie starts
7:10 pm: Movie ends - Short commentary - Stay and meet others!
7:30 pm: Event officially ends 

In Spanish, with good English subtitles - Event is Good for ALL levels

SYNOPSIS
This is the story of Roberto (Ricardo Darín), a man marked by the hard times he had over 2 decades ago - Since then, Roberto has a lonely life, hidden into his own world. One day, a strange turn of destiny wakes him up and brings him back. "Un Cuento Chino" ("A Chinese Take Away") is the story of an Argentinian and a Chinese united by a cow that falls from the sky!

TECHNICAL INFORMATION

Director: Sebastián Borensztein

Cast: Ricardo Darín, Muriel Santa Ana, Ignacio Huang, Vivian El Jaber, Iván Romanelli, Javier Pinto

Length: 93 minutes - Country: Argentina, 2010

IN SPANISH, WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES

COST $6 in advance. $10 at the door (if space is available)

Please remember that simply click as "YES" does NOT reserve a spot, only advance payment does. This goes for all our events


¡Allá nos vemos!


Jorge
results.name: Noche de Pelicula: "Un Cuento Chino" ("A Chinese Take-Away")

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

5:30 - Start. Stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
6:00 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
7:00 - Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the center table in the back.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time.

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.

Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.milkandhoneycafeny.com
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Brooklyn

Created by the insatiable founders of The Cheesecake Factory®, Grand Lux Cafe first opened in Las Vegas at the famed Venetian Resort, Hotel and Casino, and was inspired by extensive European travel exploring Italian trattorias, French bistros and the grand cafes and pastry shops of Vienna. results.description:
Join us for a Cuddle Party - an experiential workshop and social event.  Where else can you attend a workshop in your pajamas, or yoga clothes.

To attend you must purchase a ticket in advance. See details below.


Cuddle Party is … a workshop!

Though touch is natural, the skills that make it welcome and enjoyable have to be learned. Skills of communication, boundaries, asking for what you want, and saying ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ with clarity and kindness.

Cuddle Party is led by trained and certified Cuddle Party Facilitators. The Facilitator’s job is to guide you into those skills gently and easily, in a fun, safe and light hearted way. We welcome you and create an atmosphere of respect, and remain available for questions and support.

At a Cuddle Party you gain:
* Clarity and confidence
* Boundary and communication skills
* Comfort, support and encouragement
* The secrets to welcome, relaxed, non-sexual touch

The skills you learn at Cuddle Party translate into every day life, right from the start. When boundaries and consent are clear, every relationship is easier.

Where else can you attend a workshop in your pajamas?

Cuddle Party is … a social event!


We open with a Welcome Circle - about 45 minutes of introductions, rules and a few games to help everyone get comfortable. We teach communication and boundary skills in ways that are lighthearted and fun.

Then we open up for ‘free-style’ cuddling. You have plenty of time to relax, chat, share a back rub or other welcome touch, cuddle, have a snack or just hang out.

You can come to a Cuddle Party to meet new people, to enjoy amazing conversations, to touch, to be touched, to have fun, to practice asking for what you want, to practice saying “no” to what you don’t want — all in a setting structured to be a safe place for exploration and enjoyment. Shucks, you can even come to a Cuddle Party just to cuddle!

These are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get me of my assistant if you have a questions or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

Want to know more about Cuddle Party?

Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004.


There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website www.cuddleparty.com so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too

Be On Time: PLEASE arrive on time at 6:00 PM to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 6:30 PM.

No Late Arrivals: Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

What To Wear: Pajamas/Athletic Wear.  Think more comfy than sexy. 

What To Bring: A pillow or stuffed animal if you like. Otherwise, just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Registration Details


Cost: $25

Purchase Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cuddle-party-for-all-genders-tickets-20429149135?utm_term=attend&invite=ODk2Mzc5OC9hd2Fsa2VyaW50aGVjaXR5QGdtYWlsLmNvbS8w&utm_campaign=inviteformalv2&utm_source=eb... 

When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.

You must get a ticket in advance. This is the only way to ensure space will be reserved for you. Tickets must be purchased in advance - they will not be sold at the door Cost: Men $25 in advance; Women $25 in advance.

Eventbrite requires credit card payments. Sorry no exceptions or walk-ins.

Got Questions? You can post them below.
results.name: Cuddle Party™ For All Genders - Experiential Intimacy Workshop & Social Event

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages  27-42 -1F/1M spots left

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
The Secret Agent
Set in late-nineteenth-century London, Joseph Conrad's intense political thriller anticipates the espionage novels of such writers as Graham Greene and John le Carré. It concerns a double agent who is charged with provoking the radical group he has infiltrated into an act of sabotage that will bring about its own destruction. In a marvelously drawn underworld of political and criminal intrigue, Conrad brilliantly explores the confused motives that lie at the heart of terrorism. 

The Secret Agent was ranked the 46th best novel of the 20th century by Modern Library.

Because of its terrorism theme, it was noted as "one of the three works of literature most cited in the American media" two weeks after the September 11 attacks.

results.description:
Apologies for not having meetups this fall, I was dealing with some health issues in the family and time slipped away.  But it's a new year and time to get back to it!  Once again I've arranged for us to shoot at the magnificent Grand Central Terminal to keep everyone warm and dry while still dealing with low-light conditions.

However, there is a catch. Due to their rules only TEN tripods will be allowed to be extended at the same time. I am inviting 15 people in the hope that you'll find ways to double up as needed or balance on one of the many horizontal surfaces. , I recommend that everyone bring a tripod at any rate, as people will not use theirs or leave earlier than you or whatever.  No guests on this one, they'll have to sign up.

Due to concerns about people signing up and not showing up, this meetup is going to have a $5 charge. Due to my wish to keep this meetup free and about growing the night photography community, when you do show up I'll issue refunds to anyone who attends. Refunds will also be issued if this is cancelled or if you cancel more than three days in advance.

A few additional rules: We are not allowed on staircases, landings, balconies, anywhere past train gates or tenant spaces (including Vanderbilt Hall). Photos need to be used for personal use only, no commercial use. Be polite and know this is a major transportation hub, for example, don't set up your gear in front of a window selling tickets.

Please do not show up to this meetup if you do not make the list. GCT is an amazing place to shoot and I want everyone to have the opportunity, but we are hampered by their rules and we must abide. Rest assured, this will not be the only time we go to Grand Central, there will be other opportunities.

I'll see people when I hand out tripod permits and then issue refunds to those that are there (even if you're late you'll still have to see me for a permit sticker). Refunds will also be given to those who cancel three (3) days in advance or if it is canceled.
results.name: Grand Central Terminal 2016

results.description:
Hello Cuddle Folk,

Adam will be hosting a Cuddle Party at Big Buddha Yoga Studio on Sat evening, Janurary 30th  from 6:30 to 10:00 PM.

There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website (www.cuddleparty.com), so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too.Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004. 

If you are coming to the Cuddle Party, PLEASE arrive on on-time to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 6:30 PM.

Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

As a reminder, these are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get your Cuddle Lifeguard On Duty or Cuddle Caddy if you have a question or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

Cost: $25.00

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving as an announcement and an easy way to communicate, but RSVPs here don't count at all. Here’s the link:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cuddle-party-for-all-genders-tickets-20429149135?utm_term=attend&invite=ODk2Mzc5OC9hd2Fsa2VyaW50aGVjaXR5QGdtYWlsLmNvbS8w&utm_campaign=inviteformalv2&utm_source=eb... 

WHAT TO WEAR: Think more comfy than sexy. (More drawstrings, less lace! No shorts.) If you don't have PJs, tee shirts and sweat pants or yoga clothes should be OK.

WHAT TO BRING: A pillow or stuffed animal if you like. Otherwise, just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host (that's me) will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Adam

www.cuddlist.com is a proud sponsor of Cuddle PartyNYC 

Notes:

Please reach out to me if you have any specific questions etc...
results.name: Cuddle Party™ for all Genders

results.description:
I am going to try this again and host a DOCUMENTARY VIEWING and POTLUCK at my place. Please read below for more information:

Synopsis: The No Child Left Behind Act was created to boost academic levels of American students by setting standardized goals across the nation - and holding states, districts and schools accountable for performance. For urban schools in high-poverty areas, reaching these goals is a daunting task, and many now face the possibility of being taken over by the state - even being shut down. At Frederick Douglass High School in Baltimore, MD, the expectations raised by NCLB have reached a critical point. Academy Award winning filmmakers Alan and Susan Raymond (I Am a Promise: The Children of Stanton Elementary School) offer a yearlong look inside a storied institution at a time when its very existence is in doubt. From cautionary profiles to triumphant tales, Hard Times at Douglass High serves as a reminder that education is inevitably an achievement of people, not policy.

More information:

This event was brought to you by Samuel Simpson who will be providing the DVD for viewership at my place.  If you would like buy it yourself before the event: http://www.amazon.com/Hard-Times-Douglass-High-Behind/dp/B001AY6QJY. We will watch an hour of the documentary with discussion and food afterwards!

Location: My place. As the date gets closer, I will send my exact address to those who RSVP! I live on the outskirts of East Flatbush/Canarsie. If you drive, you can find parking.

We have enough space to comfortably sit about 15 in front of the big screen TV in the living room. There are already two couches that seats 6. My parents have chairs I can borrow.

Menu:

Alicia - Wings (I will also provide the plates, cups, napkins, and silverware).

Sam - Burritos from Taco Bell (chicken, beef, and bean)

Note: Please answer the question about what you are bringing to the potluck so I can update the menu when they come in. At least 5 people must RSVP for this event for it to go on or it will be cancelled! I need to know by Friday @ 8:00 pm if you will be able to attend! I am giving up a tutoring session to host it!

results.description:
Get individual tickets here, or email [masked] for information on purchasing a table at a discounted rate.

Come and celebrate the Lunar New Year with TAP-NY! On January 30th, we’re ringing in the Year of the Monkey with a barrel of fun, delicious food, and more.


The evening will start with “dim sum hour” – a new concept where you’ll munch on dumplings, spring rolls, and the like while you mingle in your classiest attire.

We’ll then take our seats for a 10 course traditional Chinese banquet consisting of delicious lobster, noodles, t-bone steak, steamed fish, and more – plus, each table will have a bottle of top shelf alcohol to welcome the New Year. During dinner, we’ll be treated to a festive lion dance and table games to find out who’s the monkey to rule them all.

When dinner is done, we’ll head out to go bananas at the afterparty at Chinatown’s newest hotspot lounge – location to be provided after registration. We promise you haven’t been before.

Buy as an individual or purchase a table (10 seats) at a discounted price of $520.

To purchase a table, please email ben.watkins[at]tap-ny[dot]org or speak with a TAP-NY board member.

Dress Code: Cocktail/Formal

See you there – it’s going to be a night even Monkey King 孫悟空 would be jealous of.

6:30 PM – Dim Sum Hour
7:30 PM to 10:30 PM – Banquet
11:00 PM to 2:00 AM – Afterparty

One thing I love about BpLoveOutdoors is the positivity, inner beauty, intelligence & strength I see whenever I'm around y'all. We don't get enough of this sooo...

Lets meetup for Fun Board Games and some good drinks in a low-key locale and get to know each other better.

Our meet & greets focus on fun and getting to know each other rather than blasting music. And I for one love me some board games so I'm excited.

Let's get out the house and keep each other warm while we talk about our upcoming adventures.

I have in my possession Scrabble, Jenga, Chess, Checkers and my fave Settlers of Catan.


Please comment below what you've got and what you can add to the party!

Note: We will be taking donations for an amazing charity on this night so pls bring $3 or however much you feel the spirit move you. (Donations go to Kids need more an Nyc org that provides a free summer camp experience, toys and hospital visits to kids with cancer or who's family is sick)

"Why just be a part of the world when you can impact it" :-)

FYI - They don't serve food here just some bites but there's a great Ethiopian and other options around if folks are interested after.

Location:

Pacific Standard Bar, Brooklyn (In The Back Room)

Close to Atlantic Terminal and many trains!
results.name: Board Games & Drinks Meet & Greet

group.name: Black People Who Love The Outdoors and Adventure NY

results.description:
I'll be camping between two hikes that I'm hosting. I plan to get into camp after dark, build a small fire to keep warm for a bit, then head to bed. I'll be packing up early the next morning to head to another event.

The group size limit for camping in the Catskills is 9. I will be making this a waitlist only event. First dibs will go to those who are attending my Balsam/Eagle or Slide Mountain hikes.

Balsam/Eagle: http://www.meetup.com/hvhikers/events/228167129/

Slide: http://www.meetup.com/hvhikers/events/228168055/

What to Bring:

It is winter and it will be cold. You need a good sleeping bag rated to 10 degrees F or lower. In addition to a sleeping bag, you need a very good sleeping pad. It is important to have insulation between you and the ground. The filling in your sleeping bag that is underneath you will be compressed and provide no insulation. I highly recommend a sleeping pad with an R value of at least 5. (Hint: most closed cell foam pads have a 2.5 R value. If you double them up you will have a combined R value of

5.)

You will also need something to keep the snow and wind off of you while you sleep. Since we're below the tree line, any small 3 season tent should do. You want something with good ventilation so that you don't get soaked in condensation over night. Avoid a big "princess" tent; these don't stand up well with a snow load.
results.name: Winter Camping in the Catskills

results.description:
Speed dating is the fun new way for single men and women to meet.


At our speed dating event, we expect around 10 men and 10 women ages 30s & 40s. Each man and woman will go on a 5-minute mini date with each other. On a "match card" that we will provide you will let us know who you liked from among the people you met. If the same person picks you in his/her match card, we will send you each others' contact info the very next day!


Speed dating is a fun and pressure free way to meet singles in NJ! Tickets are $35 if you RSVP on our Meetup group, of $50 at the door without an RSVP if space is available.

Recommended ages: Women 33-45, Men 35-45.

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.how_to_find_us: Give us a call at 1-855-MAKERBAR(625-3722) And we'll help you find the way!

results.description:
Our last wine and cheese party was hosted by Lauren, and it was a blast. 
Please bring something either homemade or store brought such as

• crackers

• fruit that goes well with cheese (e.g. grapes or figs


• wine

• artisan vegan cheese, dips or spreads etc. There is a vegan cheese shop in Brooklyn called Riverdel that has an assortment of delicious cheeses to choose from. Check it out if you get the chance.


If there ends up being a wait list and you cancel at the very last minute, be prepared to receive some serious side eye. "How do I prevent this?" you may ask. The answer is simple. Just update your RSVP as soon as you can :)


Thanks again to all of you who have hosted events at your apartment: Olivia, Cassie, Russell, Lauren, Alexandra, and Tory :)


*PERFECT EVENT FOR NEWBIE MEMBERS


I spoke to the owner of Riverdel, the incredible cheese shop in BK, and she's giving a discount to those who pick up their cheese there. They also have crackers, pate, spreads, etc. Just let one of the employees know that you're shopping for Esosa's wine and cheese party!

results.name: Mad Laughs @ Mamma V's

results.description:
We have a special Saturday night meetup at yet another new place in Nutley. Delicious Italian cuisine with a great comedy lineup for an awesome night of laughs! 7pm social/dinner, then 8pm show. Byob is allowed.


National Headliner: Joseph Anthony

NBC's Last Comic Standing, Atlantic City Borgata Comedy Club

Joseph’s father was an Italian Immigrant, who entered the United States just after WWII and began his career as a Longshoreman at the age of 17. He quickly climbed up the management ladder. His mother was born in Brooklyn, NY and raised Joseph on: delicious dishes, overbearing love, inherent O.C.D. … And incidentally, had a mean right hook - for someone who stood only 4’ 11!”

Surprisingly, being raised (in part) by his five older sisters who frequently opened Joseph’s mind up to such things as: how to use a hot curling hair kit, cleaning the crevices of wood furniture, and being a constant (mini) Hustle practice partner, all with the absence of any brothers and a father determined to figure out the fine art of betting, he (Joseph) was no stranger to the ways of the streets, but also enjoyed a quiet retreat to read and write at a very young age. The results you say? He can hold court with both Harvard and Sing Sing prison alumni, just the same. Yet despite his upbringing, he belongs to no one particular group, class, click, or innate stereotypes, as it were. In the world of entertainment, he’s simply referred to quite often as: VERSATILE – TALENTED – FUNNY - SMART!

Joseph studied writing style and screen writing at the New School for Social Research, in New York City. He learned the basics of filmmaking at the College of Staten Island, NY. He studied the Meisner technique of acting under Joanna Beckson (Ray Romano’s teacher), herself a student of the famed Actors Studio.


Feature: Sharon Simon

Saturday Night Live

Edgy, electifying and a bit sassy, comedian Sharon Simon personifies "Jewish Trash".
Growing up as the only Jewish child in an Hispanic neighborhood, her blonde hair and lack of pigment quickly earned her the sobriquet, "Flashlight".

YESTERDAY
If you watched Saturday Night Live in the 80s, and didn't blink, you MIGHT have seen a very young Sharon in a Christmas sketch. Apparently this small scene paid a lot as Sharon didn't find it necessary to appear on TV again for quite some time

While most Jewish girls use daddy's money to attend spendy colleges, Sharon stripped to pay her way through Rutgers University's drama program. Sharon briefly dated the one straight man in her acting program but alas, he too turned out to be gay.
Sharon later went on to become an EMT

TODAY
Sharon's edgy act and unique, "Jewish Trash" style is burning up clubs and colleges all over the U.S. and Canada. You can catch Sharon on Sirius Radio and as an opening act for Jim Norton, (she once used her EMT training to save a woman that collapsed during a Norton show).

TONIGHT
If Sharon isn't home in one of New York City's top clubs she is pounding an audience on the road with her refreshingly unique comedy, (that means, among other things, Sharon doesn't get on stage to complain about men and PMS).

Also performing.. John Clark, Rocco Romeo

Dinner Choices:

Sausage & Peppers

Chicken Francese

Salmon Livornese

Penne Vodka

Including: Mixed Salads, Seasonal Vegetables & Roasted Potatoes

Tickets available online. Dinner and Comedy show for one price of $35.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mamma-vittorias-comedy-night-tickets-20628706015
results.name: Mad Laughs @ Mamma V's

results.description:
" Create the highest, grandest vision possible for your life, because you become what you believe" ~ Oprah Winfrey

For those of you who have never created a vision board, its a wonderful opportunity to set goals and visions for your future.

Whether you want to visualize your success, achieve prosperity, success a vision board helps you create and focus on your prize. What is a Vision Board?

A vision board is a tool used to help clarify, concentrate and maintain focus on a specific life goal. Literally, a vision board is any sort of board on which you display images that represent whatever you want to be, do or have in your life. Lets get together for some great conversation, light food and drinks

As our first meetup of 2016, I want to make this meet-up personal and intimate, I will be hosting this event at my residence. Therefore, I will send out the location once you RSVP. I'll provide the food and material you bring the drinks. Let's kick 2016 off making new connections.

This group is about making lasting connections...

Hope to see you there!!!
results.name: Vision Board Party 2016

new players will receive an additional chip bonus with their buy-in.

Hi Everyone,

Join us for fun and competition...  RSVP NOW! Limited spots available.

We are going INDOORS in Brooklyn for SATURDAY NIGHTS (TWO SESSIONS)

8:00 PM - 10:00 PM (SESSION ONE - BEGINNER/LOW INTERMEDIATE) 

9:00 PM - 11:00 PM (SESSION TWO - INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED)

Cost:  $30 p.p. includes two hours of indoor tennis with same level players, include balls

(BEGinner, INTermediate, ADVanced players are grouped in their designated categories 8:00 PM - 10:00 PM (BEGINNER/LOW INTERMEDIATE) and 9:00 PM 11:00 PM (INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED).   

MUST RSVP NOW<a href="http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/228147846/"></a> and specify SESSION ONE OR SESSION TWO.

PLEASE ARRIVE AT LEAST 10 MINUTES EARLIER TO YOUR SCHEDULED TIME.

Look forward to meeting and playing tennis

Thanks,

Lily :)

RSVP... http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/228302666/

results.description:
Join 100+ members for this unique singles party. It's a fun, new way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer) No tix sold at door. 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_0800PM

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door). Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Jan-30-2016_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

results.description:
*DANCING at THE COPACABANA in PORT CHESTER* NOW ON JAN. 30th


What can I say, the music was good and the people that came out were great! So let's do it again!


The Copa is located in the heart of the fast-growing village of Port Chester.

  The House DJ will be playing a wide variety of Dance music for us.

This will be a Multi-Group Meetup Event

So expect a lively mix of members from

Westchester, Putnam and Western CT including  Greenwich and Stamford.

There is Free Parking behind the Copa at the Abendroth Ave municipal parking lot. And you can enter the Copa from the Abendroth Ave entrance.


ALL ARE WELCOME, FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS!

And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!

results.description: This safe and inviting space where everyone can feel free to come as they are and move however they want. There is no judgment and the practice has nothing to do with being a "good" dancer. Dance is joyful and powerful, and it's definitely made all the richer when practiced in a group, where we reflect one another's beauty and hold space for each other's pain. To witness each other and to be seen, so that we can move through the world as our most authentic selves. It's a lot of fun, and also really cathartic, as we feel into our bodies and touch into the deepest parts of ourselves...igniting bliss and releasing any blocks we might be holding. This soulful dance party will draw from various traditions that can help fuel an awesome reconnection with body and soul, including 5Rhythms, Authentic Movement, Ancient Temple Arts, Qigong, and Meditation.

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

==========================================

PLAYMUSICIAN

PlayMusician provides a platform for artists, both upcoming and established, to showcase their talent . We provide a comfortable, laid back venue with the intention of being a place where people can come together and enjoy local artists and entertainment . We help local businesses such as bars/restaurants become music venues . Playmusician has been an artist bedrock since 2010.

PlayMusician is a group that promotes local artists and musicians by creating musical events with eclectic themes and showcasing them.

Seasoned artists are matched with young up and coming musicians based on a theme.  We also promote other types of artists such as photographers, videographers, painters, comedians, dancers, etc. 

The PM  community is a growing community of artists , businesses and community  through  events, website, social media and personal networking.

results.description:
What happens when today’s leading political figures are forced to share a stage in front of a live audience with no moderator, no rules, and no limits to their insanity?

Phoenix Theatre Ensemble will be presenting the world premiere of the company’s newly commissioned work by writer, actor and performer Al Pagano titled "Filibusted' a curated selection of the verbatim recorded writings, musings and comments of U.S. Presidential candidates and other political public figures. Pagano is a classically trained stage actor, writer and has a burgeoning career in stand-up comedy. Performing with Mr. Pagano will be actress Amy Loughead.

Filibusted shares much in common with today’s nationally televised debates, in that it’s full of shi—uh, improvisation. It covers today’s most crucial (and comical) topics. Plus, it features a middle-aged white dude who talks a lot. Some would call it the American dream…we call it an outrageous night of theatre!

Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” Discount tickets for New York Comedy Picks Meetup @ $16 each (which includes a complimentary beer, wine or soft drink!). Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10062838

Show starts at 10:00 PM – arrive in lobby of theatre by 9:45 enjoy a beer or wine at concession. Running time is approximately 60 minutes. You'll have a great time.
results.name: Donald Trump as You Have Never Heard Him Before.....

results.description:
Date: 01/30/2016
Time: 10:00 PM
Meeting Place: Columbus Circle 59th St. entrance to Central Park

Join Time's Up for a safe, magical, evening ride through Riverside Park on the Upper West Side. From Columbus Circle we head west and then noodle our way north, exploring Riverside Park's bicycle-friendly pedpaths. Nearing the northernmost point on our ride, we pass Riverside Church and Grant's Tomb. Southbound, we ride the Hudson River Greenway enjoying grand vistas of the Hudson River. Many folks head home on the Greenway, but for those who want to return to our starting point, it's a pleasant ride on city streets back to Columbus Circle where the ride ends between midnight and 12:30am.

This ride covers about 8-10 miles and lasts about 2 hours. Weather? We only cancel when no one in their right mind would have fun. Dress for the weather. We hope these rides encourage folks to enjoy our parks at night: quiet, safe, and relaxed.

Time's Up website: http://times-up.org/rides/riverside-ride
results.name: Riverside Ride

results.description: Hey Everyone, Stand Up NY one of the hottest comedy clubs in the country is extending free tickets for a Late Saturday show. It is a 2 drink minimum but as you know the earlier shows are usually sold out. An Organizer will be at the end of the bar to give you tickets, please get them from him, the tickets are usually $30/each for this club but were getting it free of charge. Saturday nights are usually great to meet other people, so if you cant make the Sunday Comedy Central meetup at this club cause of Church or something heres your chance to come out and enjoy. Im not sure how long Stand Up NY will offer us a saturday evening meetup so ide come out. The line up includes: Dustin Chafin (Showtime), Yamaneka Saunders (Last Comic Standing, NBC), Jared Freid (MTV), Jon Laster (Showtime Special) and Dante Nero.

The line up includes: Dustin Chafin (Showtime), Yamaneka Saunders (Last Comic Standing, NBC), Jared Freid (MTV), Jon Laster (Showtime Special) and Dante Nero.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Last week's storm came faster and harder than everyone expect. So big in fact that it was the second largest storm which ultimately forced us to cancel last week's game. But it's not for a lack of trying.

Since last week was a bust we're going to continue with the GP fund. If you're interested in signing a card and making a donation for a gift card then please let us know.

For those that haven't played in snow, a couple of pointers. Bring cleats! Even if there's ice on the ground it shouldn't be an issue if you're wearing cleats. By the end of the first game most of the ice will have been crushed down. Bring a pair of boots and socks to change out of. Your cleats and socks will get wet when you're playing. 

So if you're game then please RSVP. No storms in the forecast for this week!

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.
