results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details: 
9:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be TWO pace groups! One at an 8:30/9:00 minute-per-mile, and one at 10:00/10:30 minutes-per-mile.


Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: It's winter, so the water fountains are turned off in all City Parks. Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Winter Catskill 3500 Series - Hunter and Southwest Hunter (a.k.a. Leavitt's Peak)

** Includes an off-trail Bushwhack to SW Hunter **


Enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding landscape from the Hunter Mountain fire tower, as well as truly superb views of trees three feet from your face on the bushwhack to SW Hunter.

** PLEASE READ THE FULL DESCRIPTION BELOW BEFORE SIGNING UP FOR THIS HIKE **

Do not sign up for this hike if you haven't read through the full event description

* Not a beginner hike *


------------------------


** RSVP Note: All RSVPs are initially to the waiting list.  We reserve the right to save spots for people we know we can rely on to show up and to be prepared for this hike.  If there are spots left, we'll open the "going" list up a few days before the event and email everyone on the waiting list at that point telling them to change their RSVP to "Yes" if they still intend on going. 

Hiking groups are limited to 20 people in this area.

------------------------


HIKE SNAPSHOT:

Estimated distance:   Approximately 9 1/3 miles

Estimated elevation gain:   Approximately 2,400 feet

Estimated time:   Approximately 6 hours, total, including breaks (possibly slower if trail conditions are tough)

Sunrise:  7:12 a.m.                        Sunset: 5:08 p.m.

--------------------------

Part of this hike is a "bushwhack"


WARNING REGARDING BUSHWHACKS: "Bushwhacks" are hikes that go off of maintained trails and through pure wilderness.  Please make sure you're very confident in your ability to navigate through the woods without trails since it is very easy to get lost in these forests. 


* Do not come on this hike without a topographic trail map for this area and a working compass. * A working, charged GPS is also recommended, but it is not a substitute for a map & compass and the skills to use them effectively.

--------------------------

Moderate Pace (not especially slow, but not especially fast - approximate 1.7 mph average moving pace over the course of the hike, and about 30 minutes of break time, total, throughout the hike). 

*** PLEASE NOTE:  While we won't be moving especially slowly, and this won't be just a leisurely stroll in the woods, this is not going to be an especially fast-paced hike, either.  This hike is specifically intended by us to be a group hike to enjoy together, and we don't want the group on this hike to get too spread out on the trail. 

So, if you want a slow-paced walk (around 1.5 mph average moving time, or slower), and will be lagging significantly behind, or if you want a noticeably fast-paced hike (i.e.  around 2 mph average moving time or faster), can't wait for us and will just end up speeding ahead and spreading our group out far along the trail, THIS ISN'T THE HIKE FOR YOU AND YOU SHOULD NOT SIGN UP.  ***

** You should have previously (and recently) completed hikes of equivalent mileage and elevation gain to this hike, in winter to do this.  You should be getting regular cardio exercise to do this.  Please check the estimated mileage and elevation gain on this before RSVPing - and please read the description IN ITS ENTIRETY. **

--------------------------


Special Gear / Requirements:


Hiking footwear (waterproof ones insulated for winter, if possible); Non-cotton, layered wicking clothing suitable for winter hiking;  Enough food/water for the hike (if you don't know how much food and water you'll need for a hike like this, you should not be on it) - KEEP IN MIND THAT HYDRATION PACK TUBES MAY FREEZE IF TEMPERATURES ARE BELOW FREEZING AND ACCOUNT FOR THAT WHEN DECIDING WHAT TO BRING YOUR WATER IN;  Trekking poles (preferably with snow baskets on them);  First aid;  Insulating shirt & rain jacket (just in case);  MICROSPIKES or HILLSOUND TRAIL CRAMPONS;  Possibly snowshoes, depending on trail conditions;  Gaiters;  WORKING HEADLAMP WITH EXTRA BATTERIES in case we (or you) don't finish before dark (the sun sets early this time of year); Catskill Trails conference map #141 and/or National Geographic Illustrated Map of Catskill Park trails (map # 755);  Compass;  GPS with relevant summits, trail junctions, etc. programmed in if you have it;  camera! ... plus any other equipment you feel is needed/appropriate.

** NOTE:  You are responsible for yourself and what equipment you bring, but it will be assumed and expected that you have the relevant topographic trail map, and a compass, with you during this hike.


--------------------------


WHO'S ORGANIZING?


Keith

(518)[masked] - no calls/texts prior to final 24 hours please

. . . and . . .

Janel

(201)[masked] - no calls/texts prior to final 24 hours please

--------------------------

MEETUP TIMES AND LOCATIONS:

9:15 a.m. - We'll meet at the parking area near the end of Spruceton Road on the right.  Do NOT park in the snow plow turnaround area at the very end of Spruceton Road. If you reach the very end of Spruceton Rd, you've gone too far.


Please be early - we leave on time.


Coordinates for the initial meeting spot on Spruceton Road are approximately:[masked], [masked]


After meeting at the above-described parking area, we'll leave some cars there and then drive a bit back (west) along Spruceton Road to the parking area along said road for Hunter and Rusk Mountains (with the metal horse mounting ramp - though that ramp might be difficult to see in the snow depending on how deep it is), where we will begin our hike.  Coordinates for that parking lot where we'll actually start the hike from are: [masked], [masked]


Please meet at the initial meet spot so we know how many cars to leave there before heading to the hike starting point at the trail head for Hunter and Rusk. 


-------------------------------------


ROUTE DESCRIPTION:

Estimated distance:  Approximately 9 1/3 miles

Estimated elevation gain:  approximately 2,400 feet


We'll initially meet at the Spruceton Road parking area on the right near the end of said road.  We'll leave some cars there and will then drive back west along Spruceton Road to the parking area for the Hunter Mountain (and Rusk) trailhead, where we'll start the hike.


We'll start out our hike on the BLUE trail toward Hunter Mountain.  We will follow that BLUE trail for approximately 3.4 miles up to the summit of Hunter Mountain and the firetower there.


We'll have a snack there and enjoy the views from the fire tower.


We will then continue over Hunter's summit on the BLUE trail heading south,  follow that for a short distance (about 0.3 mile) until it turns into the YELLOW trail at a trail junction and then follow that YELLOW trail for approximately 1.35 miles down to the RED trail.

We'll then make a right onto the RED trail.  We will follow the RED trail and very shortly pass by the Devil's Acre Lean-To.

About 0.15 mile past that lean-to we'll make a left onto the unmarked herd path up to Southwest Hunter and start our off-trail bushwhack. 


There is usually a cairn on the ground near a tree with a red trail marker at the start of that unmarked herd path, but it may be covered in snow (or knocked down) this time of year, so don't count on seeing it.  Note that this herd path can be hard to spot in winter so don't count on being able to follow it. 


We'll initially follow that herd path (or at least try to) along the base of the Southwest Hunter ridge for just over 0.5 mile of relatively flat ground until we turn abruptly to the left and head steeply uphill (in a southerly direction), for just over 0.1 mile, and bushwhack to Southwest Hunter's summit and the sign-in canister there.   

We'll then re-trace our steps back to the RED marked trail.  Once we get back to the RED trail, we'll turn left onto that trail.


From there, the trail descends gradually for about 2 miles down to beautiful Diamond Notch falls, where - depending on the temperature - we'll either see some very cold water flowing pursuant to the dictates of gravity or some very pretty icicles. 

From Diamond Notch Falls, we'll then take the BLUE trail in a westerly direction for approximately 0.7 mile to the end of Spruceton Road and will then have a short road walk to the vehicles we left at our initial meet point.

----------------------------


PACE AND TIME:

We'll be keeping a moderate pace.  Note that moderate does not mean slow - though we won't be going especially fast, either. 


Everyone coming on this hike should feel comfortable with keeping a moderate pace over the mileage AND elevation gain involved here. 


Looking at the estimated time, in conjunction with the mileage and elevation gain estimates, will give you an idea of our planned pace. 


Best estimate of total hike time is about 6 hours, including breaks (from the time we actually start the hike after driving over to the start point), though it may take longer if trail conditions are noticeably tough (i.e. if there's significant snow on the trail).


Be prepared to hike alone if you can't keep up (or pick a hiking buddy who keeps a pace similar to yours and stick with them). 

There will NOT be a sweep on this hike.


Except for the bushwhack portion of the hike up to Southwest Hunter and back, the trail is relatively well marked - but pay attention at trail junctions. 


**FAMILIARIZE YOURSELF WITH MAPS OF THE RELEVANT TRAILS AS WELL AS TRAIL DESCRIPTIONS BEFORE DOING THIS HIKE.** 


Again, there will NOT be a sweep on this hike.  We'll pace ourselves to try and finish in the predicted hike time and we expect everyone on the hike to do the same - if that time is too fast or too slow for you, you should not sign up for this hike.  


We will wait for people to regroup ONLY TO A LIMITED EXTENT at trail junctions, but because of time constraints and likely cold weather will not be able to wait more than 5 minutes or so at any given junction or for more than 10 minutes or so on summits, so don't count on us waiting at junctions if you're too far behind (especially if it's cold the day we hike). 


**** Everyone must come prepared to be responsible for themselves. ****


--------------------------------


POST-HIKE:


Afterwards, we're planning on going to Brio's, at 68 Main St., Phoenecia, NY, for a post-hike celebratory meal.  Hopefully, we'll be getting there by about 4:15 - 4:30 p.m. - we hope you'll join us there.


NOTE:  once we're done with this hike, we won't be waiting much past the predicted hiking time given in the event description above for others to finish before we leave for Brio's.  It's going to be cold, we'll have things to do (as will others on the hike) and those who have finished will be hungry.  So, if you plan on joining us out afterwards, make sure you have the address for where we're going and that you know how to get there.  Keep in mind that if you rely on a cell phone GPS that you may not have cell service at the trail head parking area, so plan ahead accordingly for that.


*******************

BE SURE TO READ THE BELOW INFORMATION BEFORE DECIDING WHETHER TO ATTEND THIS EVENT

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
I was talking to a few people about maybe hosting a one-off informal destination fun run in my neck of the woods. It is supposed to be a warmish day.

The run is about a 9.6 mile route through eastern Queens from Bayside LIRR station to New World Mall food court in Flushing - CASH ONLY (http://www.yelp.com/biz/new-world-mall-food-court-flushing). The food court opens at 10:30AM, so I am thinking at 9:17AM to coincide with the train arrival time (that is the 8:48AM LIRR train that departs Penn Station).

Exact Meeting Place:
We will meet at the parking lot of Chase Bank just south of the Bayside Station (the parking lot is in the back – you should be able to see Kelly’s taxi building and a post office from the parking lot). 


https://www.google.com/maps/place/Chase+Bank/@40.7628788,-73.7715469,19.54z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0000000000000000:0x71ec2046c0323a16

Here's the route:
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/975057511

I have rerouted the route as some of the original route were connected with long sections of snow and ice which won't melt by tomorrow. I can lead another run through the original route at another time if people are interested.

Updated turn by turn... and it's done haphazardly with google map captures. But it should be clear enough:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByKzAiI99lx4UEFhNWlWZUlyUzg/view?usp=sharing

Note about getting to the start area: 


Easiest way to get to Bayside LIRR station from Manhattan is obviously taking the LIRR from Penn Station (or Woodside station if you are near there). It is on the Port Washington line (red), and tickets cost $4.25 from Penn Station with a City Ticket on weekends which you must buy at a kiosk prior to getting on the train on the day of travel. Buying any ticket on the train will set you back quite a bit… like $15. 

You can also take Q13 from Flushing. Q13 stops at Bayside LIRR station on Bell Blvd. The Q13 bus stop in Flushing is here.
https://www.google.com/maps/@40.7610093,-73.8272895,3a,75y,223.52h,85.78t/data=!3m6!1e1!3m4!1ssT2dvQLZgN639tTL0tQq4Q!2e0!7i13312!8i6656

The bus schedule says there is a 8:55AM bus that departs Flushing that gets to Bayside LIRR at 9:17AM... but buses aren't as reliable. This bus comes every 15 minutes.

Note about time:
The train is rather prompt barring any major issues. January 31st might be cold and there are no suitable places nearby where we can gather inside. If you are taking any other transportation, please arrive earlier and hang out at Martha's Bakery with some coffee on Bell Blvd or something until meetup time. Alternatively, I guess you can gather inside the Chase ATM area with your debit card, but I’m not entirely sure how the patrons (or Chase with their CCTV) will look upon a bunch of people gathering inside.

Note about pace:
I was thinking somewhere around 8:45 to 9:00 pace. Please note that if you expect to be significantly faster or slower than this pace, you may have to fend for yourself.

Note about this route for history buffs:  
I included a small detour into Fort Totten, which was a fort that protected the East River water route. The US Military still keeps presence at this base.

Notable sights:
The route takes us underneath Throgs Neck Bridge and Whitestone Bridge, so there are some nice looking vistas.

After passing underneath Whitestone Bridge, you'll be in Malba and it is one of the more elite enclaves of NYC. If you focus less on the run and look around, you're going to see some multimillion dollar mansions, and the Malba Yacht Club with a great view of the Whitestone Bridge.


Final note:
You can't really run in downtown Flushing. Too many people and cars, so be mindful there.

results.description:
Приглашаем посмотреть на Hudson River и Catskill Mountains с обзорных точек South Mt Beacon . Мы подойдем к Fire Tower. ( Первая была построена во времена войны за независимость для того чтобы предупредить жителей NJ о приближении британских войск.) увидим многочисленные виды с высоты Scorfield Ridge

В конце путешествия для желающих великолепный кофе на Main St. в городке Beacon

Сложность средняя. Первые 40 мин. подъем, но мы никуда не торопимся:-)

Вам необходимы microspike, snowshoes

От Grand Central поезд до Beacon.

Со станции можем подобрать

------------------------

This hike climbs to the firetower atop the summit of South Beacon Mountain and follows the Scofield Ridge, passing many panoramic viewpoints over the Hudson River and the surrounding mountains.

Elevation North: 1,531 feet (467 m); South: 1,610 feet (491 m)  

Distance:  7 -10 miles

Map: East Hudson Trails 102

Trailhead GPS Coordinates

[masked],[masked] (or N41°[masked], W073°[masked])

Driving Directions

Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway to its northern terminus at the Bear Mountain Bridge. Cross the bridge, bear left onto N.Y. 9D, and proceed north on N.Y. 9D for 14.5 miles. As NY 9D (Wolcott Avenue) curves sharply to the left at Bob’s Corner Store in Beacon, turn right onto Howland Avenue. Immediately, turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson’s Mount Beacon Park.

Train

Take the Metro-North Hudson Line to the Beacon station. The trailhead is approximately 1.5 miles from the train station.  To reach the trailhead from the station turn right (south) onto Beekman Street (towards Dia Beacon).  In 0.4 mile, Beekman Street ends, and you should continue along Wolcott Avenue (Route 9D).  In about another mile, Wolcott Avenue makes a sharp right turn.  At this bend, turn left onto Howland Avenue.  The trailhead is on your right.

------------------------------------

results.description: Get in shape for backcountry skiing! Windham Mountain ski area in the Catskills has announced a very friendly Uphill Travel policy. For a $10 Uphill Travel pass, or with a regular lift ticket, you can slap climbing skins on your alpine touring or telemark skis, skin up off to the side of their ski trails, and get your kicks skiing down. 'Earn Your Turns!' (If you don't have a ski touring rig, you can strap your skis on your daypack and snowshoe up the trail, then strap your snowshoes on your daypack and ski down.) It's great exercise and a great way to practice your backcountry skiing skills when there's no natural snow around. Appropriate for intermediate to advanced downhill or telemark skiers with winter hiking experience. Windham is a commercial ski resort with chair lifts, a base lodge, food, bar, lockers, rental shop, etc. Ski helmet required. Downhill (not backcountry) ski rentals are available at the resort. Climbing skins or Snowshoe rentals are NOT available at the resort. Ride shares available from the Metro North Hudson Line. Activity will be held on Sundays, as available. Please post any questions below.

Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

results.description:
Studying for the application process at Fullstack Academy or Grace Hopper Academy? Join the workshop that takes you through the coding assessment step-by-step. We'll review the challenges and run through practice problems, answering questions along the way. 

At the end of the session, you'll feel more confident in your skills and be ready to take the next step towards becoming a developer. 

Get a better sense for the application requirements on the Admissions Prep Materials page.

Workshop Agenda

1. Welcome from Instructors

2. Test-taking strategies: tips on how to ace the admissions coding assessment

3. Coding Challenges: attendees will pair up to solve the 5+ problems in 20 minute blocks

4. Each problem will be followed by a 10 minute review to address the solution

5. Attendees will leave the workshop having completed several coding challenges and receive Review Videos

Reminders

• Bring a computer!

• Workshop begins at 10am on Sunday

• We aren't providing a lunch break, so bring snacks to tide you over!

• Please arrive on time to maximize the effectiveness of the workshop

If you are a beginner, we recommend you complete as many of the following units 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 of Codecademy's JavaScript track as possible before Sunday.

Grace Hopper Academy is the world’s first immersive coding school for women where students only pay tuition after securing a job. Our mission is to close the gender gap in technology through high-quality education, mentorship, and need-blind admissions. With a proven curriculum and educational program leveraged from partner school Fullstack Academy, Grace Hopper Academy offers an open environment for women to learn software development and become professional engineers.

results.description:
9 miles on the Palisades Park Long Path

Where:South entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk on the Manhattan side

Trail Details: This run is approx 2.5 on the bridge and 6.5 of trail. This is a mild trail, great for beginners. Keep in mind though, it does tend to get more technical the farther north you go and that there will be snow on the trail. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. Can't run 9 miles? No worries, simply turn around sooner and we'll see you back at Le Chéile.

Public Transit: Take the A train to 175th Street. The the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk is near the corner of West 178th Street and Cabrini Boulevard. (Meet at the north entrance, if the south is closed.) If you live in Jersey, meet us at the trail head on the Jersey side at 10:15-ish.

Bag Drop/Etc: Afterwards, we head to

Le Chéile for drinks and food. Le Chéile is Located on the corner of W 181st Street and Cabrini Blvd 2 blocks from the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk.

By Car: Put 839 West 181st Street, Ny 10033 in your GPS

Bag Drop/Etc: There is always a bush or a pile of leaves to stash your stuff in, just make sure everything important is on you while you run. Sometimes BTR members who own cars show up at this location.

results.description:
SPECIAL! SIGN UP FOR BOTH DAYS AND RECEIVE A FREE 1-HOUR PRIVATE INSTRUCTION SESSION ON LIGHTROOM IN FEBRUARY 2016!

This is the second class of the Lightroom Bootcamp 2016 two-part series, designed to take the foundation knowledge provided in the first part and leverage it to fully harness the true power under the hood of this software. The first half of the class will include a more in-depth look of the software, demonstrating advanced techniques and best practices to get the most out of this software.

The second half of the class will be a complete workflow demonstration using student and teachers images.  From importing to organizing, keywording and developing using multiple strategies for post-processing and finally sharing to a private web page generated using creative cloud, a complete workflow will be demonstrated encouraging student participation, decision making and addressing students questions and concerns along the way.  It is recommended that students bring their laptops for this session as this will be a very interactive experience.


https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/nWrPOayU11CKzapdXwlwrBkb7kLjxa3biTad-dcCEq7WMH1Pnhecmv7CstNi6iG163IyqvY8mA_WZ6ZOEc90MTCaZdDhqFC_edXF1fkZbHchuAZfWMECnsmjEw8ywA8-SnhA4Aiu


Click here for a gallery of some of Cliff’s recent work, showcasing what is possible using Lightroom to it’s full potential.  


Advanced techniques to be demonstrated include the new RAW HDR and panoramic merge tools, dehaze tool, radial and graduated filters with advanced brushing techniques to localize adjustments, advanced object removal with the new and improved quick brush tool, advanced black and white techniques using RAW color information,  color and tone contrast theory and application, global and localized sharpening and noise reduction techniques and more.


https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/kQU5fFMiFxsVrYIq7lN7EOp1FbHjSigRr1XkqiFZwL_Z033-pRzwVdHSsm8BiZs56N5ykSCZoq1T3owOyL6rSlscAX0tTVHFgUUqdUXm6q7q3GalGeY-LwylDLIy7K26kp8mqy3W


Topics to be covered in this 6-hour IN-DEPTH workshop:


INPUT:  Digital Asset Management (DAM):

• In-depth review of Industry leading techniques for organizing and finding your images

• Demonstration and best practices for ingest using the import module;

• Rating (stars, flags, color coding), key-wording, culling;

• How to quickly choose the best images and forget (hide - not delete!)  the rest.

• Color management and profiles;

• Facial Recognition

THROUGHPUT:  Post-processing - development module:

• Turn your images into a masterpiece (It's easier than you think);

• Parametric non-linear adjustments;

• Exposure control and correction;

• Color control and correction;

• White balance;

• Noise suppression; and

• Sharpening.

• A more in-depth analysis and demonstration of the latest features added to LR:

• Dehaze tool

• HDR merge (with RAW capabilities)

• Panoramic merge (with RAW capabilities)

• Advanced Healing brush

• “Visualize Spots” tool

• Radial Filter

• Upright

• Smart Previews

• Image workflow to Photoshop and back again (smart objects, multiple layers, etc);


OUTPUT - Sharing your images with the world:

• Review of print module basics;

• How to email multiple photographs;

• Export features and preset generation for one click sharing and export

• Creative cloud sharing: private web page generation

• Service based sharing for social media

• Gallery generation and two way syncing for personal website management

• Proper color management, printer management, soft proofing;

• Review of custom photo book layout

• How to build slideshows (with music and video); and

… and much more!


https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/0qRnZzBHQFL1ad3tH_0uvr0QNB94v2i96bU2lIXNJ6DzMqZALCrtT5zWQrHWvBm1sVRmyM0TUtZjMgtaISOEpfViQAFwk_znpLeMyDoV8ppU81ZSfC-peGnucmzAb6KIZ3fIWhvP


Required: A laptop with Version 4, 5, 6 or CC of Lightroom on it or even better - download the latest trial version - this is strongly recommended. You may download a trial version of Adobe Lightroom from the Adobe website here:


https://www.adobe.com/cfusion/tdrc/index.cfm?product=photoshop_lightroom


Please also bring the POWER CORD to your laptop as this is an ALL DAY Workshop – you will need to plug in.


https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/UtPoFGaqFVsCrGWXu8mE050mu_GJMxCK5Gx2ThfNWKtBQ33Pjt-DmMqWZToYBEZ-irlZnNylvqSjqzn6DA6b0xqBgVP2dWblAifNiDoYNOUzN68NwoQFBAYVnvwBiniokBBW4zVv


About the Instructor:

Clifford Pickett is a professional travel photographer, commercial photographer & videographer, event photographer and educator. He is based in NYC but his work takes him around the globe. He first picked up a camera while spending a year traveling through Europe after having earned his MBA early. Like many travelers, that passion for seeing and experiencing the world is precisely what ignited the spark for photography. Clifford has since spent all of his time learning how to see and capture the world with what he refers to as "a new mind". He hasn't been shooting for 40 years, he hasn't been alive for 40 years. He hasn't been classically trained in the fine arts either. He is entirely self-taught, which has formed within him his greatest asset: the ability to relate to the amateur photographer. Leveraging both the business and photography skills he has developed and maintained for over a decade, he is the owner of several successful photographic enterprises and a corporate commercial video production company working with clients such as Google, Apple, Adidas, Estée Lauder, Sephora and Clinique. His work has been featured in National Geographic, the smithsonian, and many other publications.  To see some of Cliff’s work, you may visit his website at: www.cliffordpickett.com.

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/mgZzRmmrYsyMOSWbWeJ2IffcPwT3jivMpEF-Ywmeqola7Fkug7MZiSiNoioc9fyVgYy2EVWPFSPG_PaiENBLtpV3otCrkimLJtprBLOeInk_p-1yKz5nI4RKF0Sk9kfsK267_5LF

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating, you won’t be alone!.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour brunch party.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 103 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative to while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Following the tour ( approx. 90 minutes )you are welcome to join the group at our Sunday Brunch Party at The St. Pat's Tavern.

Meet at The Pershing Square Cafe at 11:am

What to wear: Dress for the weather but you will only be outside for 15 minutes of the tour.

Can I come alone?  YES!  99% of those attending come on their own.

What to expect: 15-20 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

Cost: $15 Please bring exact change.

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/SheldonSolomon.jpg?itok=_T5GBwVW Sheldon Solomon

Richard Van Deusen presides 

Humans manage the terror of death by adhering to culturally constructed beliefs about reality that provide a sense that one is a person of value in a world of meaning, and thus eligible for either literal or symbolic immortality.  The quest for immortality underlies some of humankind’s most noble achievements.  However, it also engenders some of our most ignominious affectations, including: hostility and disdain for people with different beliefs; indifference to, or contempt for, the natural environment; and, the mindless pursuit of material possessions—which, if unchecked, may render humans the first form of life responsible for their own extinction. 

Sheldon Solomon is Professor of Psychology at Skidmore College.  His work exploring the effects of the uniquely human awareness of death on individual and social behavior has been supported by the National Science Foundation and the Ernest Becker Foundation and was featured in the award winning documentary film Flight from Death: The Quest for Immortality.  He is co-author of In the Wake of 9/11: The Psychology of Terror and The Worm at the Core: On the Role of Death in Life.  

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

After a lengthy hiatus and before the excitement that is to be Ponycon 2016, it's high time we return to our regular gaming haunt: the Uncommons Gaming Cafe in Manhattan!

For those new to the group or looking to join in for their first time, the Uncommons is NYC's very own "Gaming Cafe" - a unique blend between a gaming store and a coffee shop which offers the best of both worlds. We frequently meet here for fun, games, and ponies galore.

The Uncommons offers a wide variety of games to play for just about anybody's tastes - from eurogames, to family games, to card games, to war games, to just about any game you can think of. SO MANY GAMES!

So what does this meetup cost? The Uncommons charges a $10 rental fee for the whole afternoon - this cost covers your seat and any and all games we play until closing at 11 PM, which we frequently stay until. Be sure to show up on time/early however, as space is limited and we cannot guarantee you a seat at the table if the Uncommons is full!

How to get here:

The Uncommons is right by the West 4th St. Subway stop, which can be reached via the A, C, E, B, D, F, and M trains, and is also near the Christopher St/Sheridan Sq. Station via the 1 train. The store is on Thompson St. which is just a few blocks downtown from Washington Square Park.

results.description:
Topic: Radical Inclusion: What If Nobody Is “Other”?

Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis, Leader, Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture

Details: Racism, sexism, anti-Semitism, religious bigotry — all require that we think about the world as “Us” and “Them,” “Normal” or just unnamed and “Other.” Philosophers since about the late 18th century (Hegel) have proposed that we understand “self” — that important humanistic concept — by seeing what is not us as “other.” Neurology and psychology show that a necessary stage in very early infant development is realizing that there are “other” people and that they probably have inner lives much like ours. But oppression and bigotry also require seeing some as “same” and some as “other.” Ethical Culture proposes that no one is really the same, everyone is unique. What would our world look like if we included more and more as “Us” and “same” — or all just as unique and individual — and fewer as “other”? Is it even possible to think that way, given our neurology and enculturation? 

About the Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis is the clergy Leader of the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee. 

More information: http://www.rysec.org/event/radical-inclusion

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Building Relationships


This Improve with Improv workshop will focus on building relationships. The key to relationships is being fully present, validating others, and building trust.

You will learn techniques that will help you to shift your focus from yourself to others. Listening to and  reacting to your scene partner(s) will be practiced through exercises, games and scene work.  You will discover that when you focus on others and remove your ego from the equation, that you actually become much more interesting, creative and spontaneous.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations. 


THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV

Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


Suggested Donation: $15*

*free drink with $15 donation

**most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 or more per session**

results.description:
Let's head to Cafe Regatta for Brunch on Sunday January 31st in Pelham, starting at 12 noon - I've made a reservation for 6 and we'll be seated at 12:30. Your $3 will secure your spot.  I've often wanted to go here, with a seafood focus, they have a really interesting brunch menu. 


Caffé Regatta, serving seafood specialties, boasts a contemporary, eclectic raw bar and a cool sea-blue dining room. Popular dishes include sushi-quality ahi tuna and crab rolls. A must: the etheral chocolate soufflé. Sun brunch is available and, in the summertime, outdoor dining. The brainchild of head chef Anthony Labriola, Caffe Regatta Oyster dresses traditional ocean critters in Mediterranean duds and packs oysters and other seafood into the raw bar that made a splash in Westchester Magazine. Friendly waiters scurry past white-clothed tables and nautical decor—including miniature boats and real-life sea captains perched on the full-service bar—bearing brunch, lunch, and dinner platters piled with refreshments ranging from lemon-ricotta hotcakes to a half pound of Alaskan king-crab legs. Summertime lures patrons to the outdoor patio, and BYOB Tuesdays give the restaurant's wine list a chance to collect its pages and prepare for another week of staring into thirsty eyes. 


Some comments by other diners include: 'This was our first time at Cafe Regatta, we loved it. Brunch menu was extensive. Food and service were great. We'll be back!"


"Cosy neighborhood gem, good ambiance, friendly waiter and most of all delicious food. We were glad we made the trip from CT. Would definitely recommend to friends and return.'


"Attractive restaurant, friendly, attentive service and really good food from start to finish. A winner!"


Check out their menu: http://www.cafferegatta.com/brunchmenu.html

See you there~
results.how_to_find_us: please find us in the bar...
results.name: Let's go to BRUNCH at Cafe Regatta in Pelham !

group.name: Cheap Eats and other foodie delights of Westchester

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

Who's up for a nice brisk urban hike?   Ahh c'mon it was so much fun last year!, And it was the best attended event second to the Chocolate Tour. 27 women walked across with us.


If you are dressed in layers, and your ears and head are covered, and you are wearing comfortable cold weather boots or shoes, the 1.2  mile walk will be a breeze..lol.

So we will gather across the street from the entrance to the Bridge on Chambers and Center street ( there is a little park there with grass and trees) we will meet in front of that park at 12.

The walk will take approximately one hour to complete.  Then, for the first 10 women who respond, we will stop to warm up and  have brunch at a beautiful, sustainable, farm to table, restaurant only a 5 minute walk from the bridge in Dumbo called Atrium Dumbo. here is the link :  http://www.atriumdumbo.com/brunch/.

There are a variety of hot and cold brunch foods, and a very nice selection at that. They can only accommodate 10 of us at a table.


There are only 2 ways you can RSVP for the Brunch:

1) I will ask a question at the time of your RSVP.. if you answer yes, please reserve a seat for me, And you are one of the first 10 women to RSVP, then you have a seat at the table.  0r

2) you can email me under separate cover [masked] .

Pick one way Or the other to let me know and if you are a plus one you will have 2 seats at the table..

In all earnestness, please do not RSVP until you are 98 percent sure you will be attending so you don't have to change your RSVP and I can get an accurate head count. I am not going to have a waitist, since some will RSVP for the walk, and not be interested in Brunch at all. This is the most efficient way to set this up.

Once I've reached the 10 RSVP's for Brunch , I will send out a separate meetup announcement to the group the the Brunch is full.  But you can still RSVP for the Walk.


Then you can make individual reservations, if you care to, at the same time.

We have a 1:30 reservation at Atrium Dumbo.


PS only the first 10 can be accommodated, so if you want to join us for  brunch, and you RSVP late , you can make your own reservations and sit at a separate table with your friend (s).


Whoever wants to walk back together, may do so afterwards, Others may want to take the subway back.. it's all up to you.

I look forward to seeing you.


Remember, when you RSVP,  you can RSVP for just the walk, or the Walk and Brunch, but not just brunch.

Looking forward to a fun filled day, of walking, talking, meeting new friends, etc.

Let's get this party started!

Take my cell # with you and CALL me if you are running late,


[masked]


I will pass the hat to newcomers, for a $5 donation to keep the meetup site operational.


Hugs,

Carly

[masked]


xxxx
results.name: Walk across the Historic Brooklyn Bridge, Brunch in Dumbo,Walk back to Manhattan

WICKED is the untold story of the witches of Oz.  Long before Dorothy drops in, two other girls meet  in the land of Oz. One, born with emerald-green skin, is smart, fiery & misunderstood. The other is beautiful, ambitious and very popular. WICKED tells the story of their remarkable odyssey, how these two unlikely friends grow to become the Wicked Witch of the West and Glinda the Good.

WICKED is based on the  novel by Gregory Maguire, has music and lyrics by Stephen Schwartz, and a book by Winnie Holzman. The production is directed by Joe Mantello with musical staging by Wayne Cilento.

Get Tickets Here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wicked/

results.description:
Peaceful Greetings Everyone,

A Happy and Most Blessed New Year. Change has already started on paramount levels, with the universe asking all of us to surrender in ways we would have never imagined. I look at this new alignment as so transformative, yet my heart is with all those who feel alone or at a loss as to how to effectively transition with less struggle and more peace. I am back at the Oaks again in a few weeks as space was available, facilitating a workshop along with my colleague Anton. We are offering this once again on a suggested donation basis. No one will be turned away for lack of funds. It was a great turn out last time. RSVP is required. There were many that showed up last minute and we would appreciate knowing ahead of time who will join us. The spirits have a lot to share as always. I promise our time together will be transformational!

I look forward to seeing you..and please feel free to pass along this announcement to anyone you feel might benefit from the group.

God Bless and keep you safe,

Laura


Healing Beyond Boundaries: With Messages from the Spirit World

 In this experiential workshop, come and explore the possibilities that might just lead you to your authentic self. Spiritual, emotional, physical patterning and trauma, lead many of us to question our purpose and perceived realities in everyday living. This constant questioning may also lead to soul loss. Most of the time we can only see things from a place of fear and uncertainty , not how they actually are, or how they might be if we hold them in a space of sacredness. Retrieving soul pieces takes great patience, courage and a certain amount of acceptance.  It also takes great honesty to stare into the mirror and come to the realization of the difference between who you think you are and who you really are.

The first thing you will learn is that you are not alone. Everyone participates at various levels. Through connecting with the spirit world. group process work, and various healing tools we'll start a journey together and see what unfolds. Since this is an experiential workshop, be open to healing things happening!

The workshop will be 3 hours long. 1/2 hour will be used for group  Chi-gong healing exercises and another 1/2 hour for a break to eat lunch or interact and share. This is about you and your time. Bring whatever you need to make yourself comfortable. Water, snacks or lunch to eat on the break etc...

THIS WORKSHOP HAS A SUGGESTED DONATION OF $20 TO BENEFIT THE SPACE THAT IS OFFERED TO US BY THE NEW DAWN FOUNDATION. PLEASE BRING EXACT FEE. CHECKS MAY BE MADE PAYABLE TO THE NEW DAWN FOUNDATION.

Facilitators: Laura Aversano and Anton Baraschi  
Laura Aversano has been in private practice for over 19 years, serving clients physically, emotionally, psychologically, and spiritually. She is best known as a medical and spiritual intuitive medium, with extensive training in counseling and development, energy medicine, shamanism, body-centered therapies such as cranial sacral work and applied kinesiology, and the healing arts. Her books include; The Divine Nature of Plants, The Light of God,  Plant Spirit Journey and Spiritwalker. She has worked with thousands of people all over the country and in various parts of the world.  You can read more about Ms. Aversano’s work at <a>www.LauraAversano.com.</a>  


Anton Baraschi is a bioenergy specialist, teaching and practicing bioenergy healing (aka medical qigong) in Manhattan at the Edgar Cayce ARE Center, with a focus on integrating multiple bioenergy healing modalities in supporting the work of medical professionals. Bioenergy healing stimulates a person’s own immune system with emphasis on the condition diagnosed by the doctor. Bioenergy healing is considered helpful on alleviating pain, chronic conditions and symptoms without a particular diagnostic, and for spiritual development. You can read more about Anton and Bioenerg  y  healing  at www.energeticrejuvenation.com  

<a>Date: Sunday, January 31st, 2016
Time and Place: 12 noon to 3 pm The Oaks at the New Dawn Foundation (the smaller white mansion on the property)
590 Davenport Avenue New Rochelle NY 10805   www.theoaksndf.org </a> 

SUGGESTED DONATION OF $20

How many times have you walked through Grand Central and actually taken time to really appreciate how beautiful it is? With this Scavenger Hunt you will not only get to appreciate one of  New York's most iconic buildings, but you will get to meet dozens of interesting NYSN members and friends in a fun and casual way. 

Come alone or with a friend and we will team you up with others attending.  Enjoy a cocktail or cup of coffee with the group then we will send you out on your adventure.

Each team will have 75 minutes to complete the scavenger hunt with a list of questions, challenges, and puzzles.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Following the hunt you can stay at St. Pat's for our Sunday Brunch Party.

Cost: $10 : Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

What to wear: dress for the weather but 98% of the clues are inside Grand Central

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We will team you up with other fun people.

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Model Spotlight: Glamour & Implied Shoot w/Marlene - Jan.31st"

(Rescheduled Snow Date)

 With the success of our last Model Spotlight, we decided to setup another Spotlight shoot this month with returning beauty Marlene. She was such a big hit last time and we're happy to have her back at the studio for this glamour and pre-valentine shoot.

About Model Spotlight shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Limited smaller group than our bigger shoots) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, sets, add props and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (I will be on hand to help where needed.)

About the Shoot:

There will be three looks with a possibly 4th pending time. (We squeezed in a 4th setup on our last shoot.) First we will shoot Marlene in swimwear in one of our backdrops for a pinup style. Second look will be lingerie using our LED lighting which proved very popular at our last shoot. Third, will be an implied look with a "bed of roses", pre-valentine look.

RSVP:

NEW: Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. From here on in, we have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. This will ensure that we have the minimum amount of RSVP to actually hold the Meetup. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit. (This also lets anyone on a waitlist able to join the shoot if you are not sure of your attendance yet.) Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page. (No, deposit is needed if you are on the waitlist but check back to see if your waitlist status has been updated to "Yes".)

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $20 (Paypal)

(Don't mark the checkbox as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Model: 

Marlene (Marly Mar) : Instagram or Facebook

(Photos provided by model for promotional purposes only. All rights their respective owners.)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the models beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Model Spotlight: Glamour & Implied Shoot w/Marlene - Jan. 31st

results.description:
Living From Open-Hearted Awareness: a Daylong Retreat with Loch Kelly

Awakening is not something only a few spiritually evolved humans can achieve: it is part of everyone's natural potential. Rather than meditating to calm and focus your mind, we will learn to intentionally shift into open-hearted awareness, which is already calm, stable, and able to effortlessly focus. It is possible to know and live from your True Self with a deep sense of well-being, creativity and unconditional love.

Loch will draw from the ancient wisdom of Sutra Mahamudra and other nondual traditions, as well as current neuroscientific research to point us beyond our ego-centered identity in order to live from an open-hearted awareness.

We will learn how to know your true nature and live from open-hearted awareness through contemporary versions of ancient wisdom practices such as effortless mindfulness, nondual awareness, embodied presence and small glimpses many times. We will discover that ignorance and confusion will begin to liberate and all experiences, parts of ourself, and emotions are welcomed.

 • Pre-Registration online HERE is $60.

 • Registration at the door is $70


About Loch Kelly, MDiv., LCSW:


Loch is the author of, Shift into Freedom: The Science and Practice of Open-Hearted Awareness. He is an educator, consultant, and recognized leader in the field of nondual meditation and psychotherapy who was asked to teach Sutra Mahamudra by Mingyur Rinpoche and nondual realization by Adyashanti. The founder of the Open-Hearted Awareness Institute, he is an emerging voice in modernizing meditation, social engagement, and collaborating with neuroscientists at Yale, UPenn and NYU to study how awareness training can enhance compassion and wellbeing. For more, visit lochkelly.org.

Please visit www.lochkelly.org for more information about his book, Audio CD, and upcoming events.

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING


We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 12pm y jugamos hasta las 2:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR


Se jugaran partidos de 10 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Eso es todo. Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of 37th Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn (use 4th Avenue entrance)
results.name: Are You Ready For Some Weekend FUTSAL????

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 12:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 12:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

Join New York Adventure Club for a private tour of the 1887 Eldridge Street Synagogue, a breath-taking National Historic Landmark located on New York City's Lower East Side.

Led by the museum's Education & Program Associate, this experience will include a look at the synagogue's history, architecture, monumental new stained-glass window, and religious / architectural objects brought out from the archive specifically for Adventure Club.

Afterwards, we'll grab some food and drinks in Chinatown!

results.description:
This month's book is Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie 

Location is TBD depending on how many people RSVP

Synopsis provided by Amazon: Ifemelu and Obinze are young and in love when they depart military-ruled Nigeria for the West. Beautiful, self-assured Ifemelu heads for America, where despite her academic success, she is forced to grapple with what it means to be black for the first time. Quiet, thoughtful Obinze had hoped to join her, but with post-9/11 America closed to him, he instead plunges into a dangerous, undocumented life in London. Fifteen years later, they reunite in a newly democratic Nigeria, and reignite their passion—for each other and for their homeland.
results.name: January Wanderful Book Club:  Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

results.description:
Fun Afternoon of Clay and Laughs while learning to Spin a Pottery Wheel

  You’ll learn how to make your very own pinch pot.

 Everyone begins with a hand building project based on a pinch pot; from there you create whatever your imagination conjures up. 


Next watch a quick detailed demo of the potter's wheel then it’s our turn! 

Everyone will get 2 chances to create SOMETHING!

 Keep in mind, the potter's wheel is not easy (no worries, they’re there to help you!)  It's all Fun!

Next leave your creation with them; they’ll take care of the rest!  You will choose glazes….Pots will be ready within 3 weeks!  I will be happy to pick them up for everyone!

They supply some snack foods ~ Feel Free to Bring along a Bottle of Wine or Whatever makes you :)

Cost is $50.00 ~ 3hr class
Just follow the link to sign up! 

http://mkt.com/madisonmudclaystudio/special-event-sip-spin-dec-th

Please let me know once you have signed up for the class ~ Thanks!

We will stop at "54 Main" afterwards for a bite to eat...

results.description:
Hi all, 

I've settled on the latest book by Anthony Marra, called The Tsar of Love and Techno: Stories.  A series of interlocking short stories that read more like a novel (according the the reviews).  This is on many of the "best of 2015" lists.  

Here's a blurb about the book:

From the New York Times bestselling author of A Constellation of Vital Phenomena—dazzling, poignant, and lyrical interwoven stories about family, sacrifice, the legacy of war, and the redemptive power of art.

This stunning, exquisitely written collection introduces a cast of remarkable characters whose lives intersect in ways both life-affirming and heartbreaking. A 1930s Soviet censor painstakingly corrects offending photographs, deep underneath Leningrad, bewitched by the image of a disgraced prima ballerina. A chorus of women recount their stories and those of their grandmothers, former gulag prisoners who settled their Siberian mining town. Two pairs of brothers share a fierce, protective love. Young men across the former USSR face violence at home and in the military. And great sacrifices are made in the name of an oil landscape unremarkable except for the almost incomprehensibly peaceful past it depicts. In stunning prose, with rich character portraits and a sense of history reverberating into the present, The Tsar of Love and Techno is a captivating work from one of our greatest new talents.


http://www.amazon.com/The-Tsar-Love-Techno-Stories/dp/0770436439/ref=cm_cr_pr_product_top?ie=UTF8


Hope you can join us to discuss this book!

Amy
results.name: Discuss our recent read:  The Tsar of Love and Techno: Stories by Anthony Marra

results.description:
We are combining 2 of the biggest new year's resolutions (to be healthier and meet new people) into the ultimate healthy social event - Juice Crawl.  

Juice Crawl is made up of a community of people who want to have fun in a healthy atmosphere. It is a great way to meet health conscious individuals and experience different health and wellness brands. 

Must purchase in advance here (space is limited) - http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/lou/2485123

What is a Juice Crawl? 

It's a fun, social and healthy living event similar to a traditional pub crawl except we workout and travel to juice bars. Hang with fellow juice lovers, yogis, runners, health conscious individuals etc... Anyone is welcome! 

1 TICKET COVERS IT ALL: 
Sample 20 + different types of juices. 
Free Fitness Class. 
Total value = over $100

*Tickets are just $49. Save $9 each when you bring a friend! 

*Must purchase ticket in advance at this link to attend - http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/lou/2485123

*Approximate Timeline (may vary): 

1:00pm - Check-in begins 
1:30-2:30pm - Pre-Crawl Fitness at Athleta in Flatiron (optional) 
3:00-4:00pm - Drink juice and hang out at Juice Press, The Juice Shop, and Terri 

*If for any reason you are running late or cannot find us, call organizer (Anna)[masked] 

Check out video to learn more: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=spOnIBhb7jc

GET TICKETS HERE - http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/lou/2485123
results.name: Juice Crawl (Sample Over 20 Juices + Free Fitness Class!) PREPAY ONLY EVENT
