results.description:
Short Version: 

Please use this as a forum to make suggestions for the direction of the club in 2016. What do YOU want to see offered? RSVP = your intention/hope to be an active member in the coming year. Comments = share your ideas!

Long Version: 


Hello fellow trail runners and future trail runners!

We have had a great season that kicked off in late Summer and ran through the Fall with over 75 opportunities to join the Watchung Reservation Running Club on the trails, road, track, and at events!

As we move into the Winter season, now seems a great time to extend a few thank yous as well as ask YOU what direction you would like to see the club go in 2016. It’s important to know that this club can be anything we want it to be, don’t be fooled by the name. We have had meetups and interest in trails outside of the Watchung Mountains, road workouts, road races, track work, hikes, and both trail and non-trail events. 

Please use this opportunity to speak loudly and be heard! If you’re an active member, send your feedback about what you enjoyed this Fall and suggestions for improvement. If you have yet to join us, tell us why! Feedback about distance, experience, terrain, pace, location, and schedules will all be appreciated. We are also actively seeking new event hosts. The commitment can be as simple as a desire to share one of your workouts with the group. 

A huge thank you goes out to Michael and Chris for regularly posting and sharing their workouts with our members. Without these ongoing efforts we wouldn’t have a group to speak of. Not only did they open their personal schedules up to all of us, but I’ve seen them first hand exhibit amazing leadership abilities in sharing information about the trails or workout, answering questions, and wholeheartedly following the “no man left behind” mantra. We have also had a few brave souls who generously posted suggested meetups or signed up to be event hosts in the near future. Stephen has already begun sharing workouts and has posted an event for late Spring!

A thank you is also in order to each and every member who attended a meetup this Fall. As we get up and running (pun intended), it took a leap of faith on each of your parts to trust in your host, the club, the meetup system, and be open and willing enough to meet new faces and share a run. 

Here is to a great start and a bright future! Thank you for continuing to be a part of and strengthen our community of runners…see you out there!
Tears
results.name: Online Discussion: WRRC in 2016

results.description:
It's the second meet up and I'm super excited to join forces with LIC Beer Project as our sponsor for our next shindig!!! 

This local Queens based brewery is an up and coming gem in the craft beer community with a STUNNING brew house and tap room. Luckily, we get to bring their delicious fresh beers right down the road to Alewife for another fun meetup with a rep from the brewery, swag giveaways, and a food pairing menu with 100% of the profit going to homeless LGBT youth! We'll be working with New Alternatives to help kids who have no other options get the food, education, clothing, and training they need to feel empowered in a world that had before cast them aside. I can't think of a better time in the world to reach out and help someone, especially by drinking great craft beer and eating amazing food! 

http://youtu.be/p_zqoyu2rXs

Hoping to see you all back at this second meetup, and hopefully some fresh faces too!!! Bring your friends and Allies, as all are welcome in the world of beer :)

We'll be announcing the food menu, beers, and updates closer to the 31st. CHEERS BEER QUEENS!!!

-Alexa

results.description:
What happens when today’s leading political figures are forced to share a stage in front of a live audience with no moderator, no rules, and no limits to their insanity?
Phoenix Theatre Ensemble will be presenting the world premiere of the company’s newly commissioned work by writer, actor and performer Al Pagano titled "Filibusted' a curated selection of the verbatim recorded writings, musings and comments of U.S. Presidential candidates and other political public figures. Pagano is a classically trained stage actor, writer and has a burgeoning career in stand-up comedy. Performing with Mr. Pagano will be actress Amy Loughead.
Filibusted shares much in common with today’s nationally televised debates, in that it’s full of shi—uh, improvisation. It covers today’s most crucial (and comical) topics. Plus, it features a middle-aged white dude who talks a lot. Some would call it the American dream…we call it an outrageous night of theatre!
Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” Discount tickets for NYC Theatre on a Budget Meetup @ $16 each (which includes a complimentary beer, wine or soft drink!). Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at
https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10062843 Show starts at 7:00 PM – arrive in lobby of theatre by 6:30 enjoy a beer or wine at concession. Running time is approximately 60 minutes. You'll have a great time.
results.name: FILIBUSTED - Politicos in  their own words... LOL

results.description:
Filibusted' a curated selection of the verbatim recorded writings, musings and comments of U.S. Presidential candidates and other political public figures!!! Trump, Ted, Hillary, Trump, Bernie, Marco, Trump, Chris .... Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” Discount tickets for Alternative to the Bar Fun Things to Do NYC Meetup @ $16 each (which includes a complimentary beer, wine or soft drink!). Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10062843

Show starts at 7:00 PM – arrive in lobby of theatre by 6:30 - 6:45 enjoy a beer or wine at concession-- take it with you into the theatre and hear the confessions of the likes of Wayne Lapierre ... better make that 2 beers.

results.description:
2 Dance Groups Attending This Event!

Come out for a dance workshop on Salsa & Bachata @ The Wellness On The Green Studio In Morristown NJ On Sunday January 31st.

The class will start promptly at 7pm. Will include a split class for salsa & some bachata of beginner & advance levels. About An Hour For The Class. We will conclude the workshop with a practice session to rehearse everything you've learn to music. About 1.5 Hour duration for this workshop. You may want to bring a bottle of water and don't forget to wear comfortable shoes.

$10 Per Person.

Come out and join the group for this workshop. Your guaranteed to have fun, meet some wonderful people, and learn some new dance moves along the way.

The studio is located Above the E-Trade Building. Free street parking available. No fee on Sundays. Also parking lot garages in the area but there is a charge if you use them.

Info On Salsa & Bachata:

Salsa- A very popular dance and musical style often heard and danced at latin clubs all over the world. There are many different variations to it, but some very basic fundamental moves and timing structure that are fairly common. Becoming a really good salsa dancer like any other skill requires practice & repetition, but the reward of being able to move effortlessly on the dance floor is more than enough reason to Practice, Practice, Practice!!!

Bachata- A sexy sensual dance that has really become popular over the last decade. Although not considered as difficult a dance as the salsa. It also has it's share of difficult patterns as one progresses through the learning stages. The bachata sound is fairly easy to identify with its pronounced guitar sound & constant percussion tap on the fourth beat. It's becoming a dance that is essentially a must learn dance to be able to use it at any latin night!
results.name: Latin Dance Workshop by Maria and Tony In Morristown! Split Levels!! $10PP

group.name: The Salsa Latin & Ballroom Dance Group

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Savoury

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Jan 24, 2016 - March 6th
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452342

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.
results.name: Indoor gym soccer-Fleetwood

results.description:
The Rink is the centerpiece of Bank of America Winter Village at Bryant Park. The 170' x 100' rink features free admission ice skating, in addition to high quality rental skates, skating shows, special events, and activities.
We'll be also getting hot cocoa and food from the Winter Village around the area.

General admission to skate at the Winter Village is free.

Skate Rental: $15
Helmet Rental: $6
Large Bag Check: $10
Small Bag Check: $8
Locks: $9
Locker Usage: Free
Skate sharpening: $20

We'll first meet at the Le Pain Quotidien on W 40th St - facing the park. Le Pain Quotidien is near the corner of Avenue of the Americas and W 40th. We'll walk over to the park once we gather enough people.
results.name: Bryant Park Ice Skating!

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:

Starting at 8pm, we will have some of the best episodes airing so that you can enjoy the return of our TWD themed food and drink menus. There will be an INDIVIDUAL Trivia Contest with the Grand Prize being a replica of The Walking Dead Michonne Katana Sword. 


Don't worry, second and third place winners will win some TWD Pop-Vinyls. There will also be a Quick Round Trivia with regard to The Walking Dead Graphic Novels. Grand Prize for that will a copy of the 150th Issue! 


To make this night even more fun, we're challenging you all to a Cosplay Contest, make us believe that the characters we all know and love are joining us for this very special night! Prize for best costume will be a Bayou Restaurant Gift Card!

Your hosts will be Walking Dead Enthusiasts Stephanie and Sean so it's bound to be a fun night!

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
